module.name: laz2_DOM
module.short: Provides an implementation of DOM interfaces.

descr.p: laz2_dom.pas provides an Implementation of DOM (Document Object Model) interfaces. It is a modified copy of the FCL dom.pp unit (revision 15251) adapted to use UTF-8 instead of WideString by Mattias Gaertner.

Copyright (c) 1999-2000 by Sebastian Guenther, sg@freepascal.org
Modified in 2006 by Sergei Gorelkin, sergei_gorelkin@mail.ru
This unit provides classes which implement the interfaces defined in the DOM (Document Object Model) specification. The current state is:

Specification used for this implementation:
Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Specification

element.name: INDEX_SIZE_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 1.
element.descr: Index or size is negative, or greater than the allowed value.

element.name: DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 2.
element.descr: Specified range of text does not fit into a DOMString.

element.name: HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 3.
element.descr: Node is inserted somewhere it does not belong.

element.name: WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 4.
element.descr: Node is used in a different document than the one that created it (that does not support it).

element.name: INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 5.
element.descr: An invalid or illegal character is specified, such as in a name.

element.name: NO_DATA_ALLOWED_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 6.

descr.p: Data is specified for a node which does not support data.

element.name: NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 7.
element.descr: An attempt was made to modify an object where modifications are not allowed.

element.name: NOT_FOUND_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 8.

descr.p: An attempt was made to reference a node in a context where it does not exist.

element.name: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 9.

descr.p: Implementation does not support the type of object requested.

element.name: INUSE_ATTRIBUTE_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 10.

descr.p: An attempt was made to add an attribute that is already in use elsewhere.

element.name: INVALID_STATE_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 11.

descr.p: An attempt was made to use an object that is no longer usable.

element.name: SYNTAX_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 12.

descr.p: An invalid or illegal string was specified.

element.name: INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 13.

descr.p: An attempt was made to modify the type of the underlying object.

element.name: NAMESPACE_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 14.

descr.p: An attempt was made to create or change an object in a way which is incorrect for the defined namespaces.

element.name: INVALID_ACCESS_ERR
element.short: Represents DOM exception code 15.
element.descr: Parameter or operation is not supported by the underlying object.

element.name: ELEMENT_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Elements.

element.name: ATTRIBUTE_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Attributes.

element.name: TEXT_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Text nodes.

element.name: CDATA_SECTION_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM CDATA nodes.

element.name: ENTITY_REFERENCE_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Entity References.

element.name: ENTITY_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Entities.

element.name: PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Processing Instructions.

element.name: COMMENT_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Comments.

element.name: DOCUMENT_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Document Elements.

element.name: DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Document Type Declarations (DTD).

element.name: DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Document Fragments.

element.name: NOTATION_NODE
element.short: Represents the node type for DOM Notation Declarations.

element.name: TSetOfChar
element.short: Defines a set with values using the Char type.

element.name: DOMString
element.short: Type used for String values in DOM interfaces.

element.name: DOMPChar
element.short: Type used for Pointers to Char values in DOM interfaces.

element.name: DOMChar
element.short: Type used for Char values in DOM interfaces.

element.name: PDOMString
element.short: Type used for Pointers to DOMString values.

element.name: EDOMError
element.short: Base class for exceptions raised in DOM interface classes.

element.name: EDOMError.Code
element.short: Error code constant for the exception.

element.name: EDOMError.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is an overloaded variant of the constructor for the class instance. It allows an additional ASituation argument which describes the circumstance (or the class and method) where the Exception is raised. It calls the inherited constructor using the values in the ClassName property and the ASituation parameter as arguments.
This variant of the constructor is used in the implementation of methods of DOM classes like: TXMLDocument, TDOMDocument, TDOMImplementation, TDOMNamedNodeMap, TDOMNode, TDOMNode_NS, and TDOMElement.

element.name: EDOMError.Create.ACode
element.short: Error code for the DOM exception.

element.name: EDOMError.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMIndexSize
element.short: Exception raised for an invalid index size.

descr.p: EDOMIndexSize is an EDOMError descendant which implements an exception raised when an invalid character position or offset is specified in TDOMCharacterData or TDOMText methods.

element.name: EDOMIndexSize.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. It calls the inherited method using the INDEX_SIZE_ERR constant and the ASituation parameter as arguments.

element.name: EDOMIndexSize.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMHierarchyRequest
element.short: Exception raised when an inserted node is not valid for the Document Object Model (DOM).

descr.p: Used to ensure the pre-insert integrity of the hierarchical structure for the DOM node tree. Prevents violation of constraints for the Document Object Model (DOM).

element.name: EDOMHierarchyRequest.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. It calls the inherited method using the HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR constant and the ASituation parameter as arguments.

element.name: EDOMHierarchyRequest.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMWrongDocument
element.short: Exception raised when a node is used in a document other than the one that created it.

descr.p: Raised in methods like TDOMNode_WithChildren.InsertBefore and TDOMImplementation.CreateDocument.

element.name: EDOMWrongDocument.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. It calls the inherited method using the WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR constant and the ASituation parameter as arguments.

element.name: EDOMWrongDocument.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMNotFound
element.short: Exception raised when a node is accessed in a context where it does not exist.

descr.p: Raised in methods like:

element.name: EDOMNotFound.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMNotFound.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMNotSupported
element.short: Exception raised when the DOM implementation does not support the requested object type or operation.

descr.p: Raised in methods like:

element.name: EDOMNotSupported.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method using the NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR error constant and the value in ASituation as arguments.

element.name: EDOMNotSupported.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMInUseAttribute
element.short: Exception raised when adding an attribute that is already in use.

descr.remark: Not used in the current LazUtils implementation.

element.name: EDOMInUseAttribute.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMInUseAttribute.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMInvalidState
element.short: Exception raised when accessing an object that is no longer usable.

descr.remark: Not used in the current LazUtils implementation.

element.name: EDOMInvalidState.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMInvalidState.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMSyntax
element.short: Exception raised when an invalid or illegal value is specified for a DOM object.

descr.remark: Not used in the current LazUtils implementation.

element.name: EDOMSyntax.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMSyntax.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMInvalidModification
element.short: Exception raised when an attempt was made to modify the type for an object.

descr.remark: Not used in the current LazUtils implementation.

element.name: EDOMInvalidModification.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMInvalidModification.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMNamespace
element.short: Exception raised when an object is changed in a way that is invalid for its Namespaces.

descr.p: Raised in the TDOMNode_NS.SetPrefix method.

element.name: EDOMNamespace.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMNamespace.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: EDOMInvalidAccess
element.short: Exception raised when a parameter or operation is not supported by the object.

descr.remark: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: EDOMInvalidAccess.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: EDOMInvalidAccess.Create.ASituation
element.short: Provides context information for the exception.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum
element.short: Enumeration with flag values for DOM Nodes.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum.nfReadonly
element.short: Node is read-only.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum.nfRecycled
element.short: Node is recycled.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum.nfLevel2
element.short: Node is a DOM Level 2-specific type.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum.nfIgnorableWS
element.short: Node contains ignorable whitespace only.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum.nfSpecified
element.short: Node value was specified rather than implied.

element.name: TNodeFlagEnum.nfDestroying
element.short: Node is being destroyed.

element.name: TNodeFlags
element.short: Set type used to store TNodeFlagEnum values.

descr.p: TNodeFlags is the type used to implement the Flags property in TDOMNode and descendants.

element.name: TDOMNodeEnumerator
element.short: Implements an enumerator for DOM Nodes.

descr.p: TDOMNodeEnumerator is a class used to implement an enumerator for DOM Nodes. The enumerator is created for a specified DOM node, and provides access to the top-level children for the DOM node. It does not descend any lower than the first child node and its sibling nodes in the DOM sub-tree.
Use the MoveNext method to select the next child node in the enumerator. Use the Current property to access the current DOM node for the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeEnumerator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TDOMNodeEnumerator.Create.Node
element.short: DOM node examined in the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Gets the First child or the next Sibling as the Current value for the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: DOM node to use as the Current value for the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeEnumerator.Current
element.short: Current DOM node for the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator
element.short: Implements an enumerator that visits all Children in the sub-tree for a DOM node.

descr.p: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator is a class used to implement an enumerator for a specified DOM node that visits all child nodes in its sub-tree. The enumerator uses the GetNextNode method in TDOMNode to get the value in the Current property. This means it will recursively descend into ChildNodes, and is halted when the next sibling for the specified DOM node is reached.
Use the MoveNext method to get the next DOM node for the enumerator. Use the Current property to access the currently selected DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.Create.Node
element.short: DOM node examined in the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Gets the next DOM node for the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: DOM node used as the Current value for the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.Current
element.short: Current DOM node selected in the enumerator.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.GetEnumerator
element.short: Gets the enumerator class instance.

element.name: TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.GetEnumerator.Result
element.short: Enumerator class instance.

element.name: TDOMNode
element.short: Implements the DOM Node interface.

descr.p: TDOMNode is a class which implements the Node interface in the Document Object Model (DOM).

TDOMNode represents a single node in a DOM document. It includes NodeName, NodeValue, NodeType, and Attributes properties with information common to all nodes in a document tree. The ParentNode, ChildNodes, and OwnerDocument properties provide access to the tree structure for a DOM document.

TDOMNode implements the full DOM Level 2 specification, and provides partial support for the DOM Level 3 specification. It also provides extensions to the DOM Node interface that allow locating or cloning a node, perform name comparisons, or access its node flags.

TDOMNode is used as the ancestor for other specialized Node types, as specified in the DOM specification. These descendent classes may alter the base value and/or behavior as required for the specialized node type.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

descr.p: GetNodeName is an abstract virtual method DOMString function. It is used to get the value for the NodeName property. It is overridden in descendent classes to provide the name needed for the DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNodeValue
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeValue property.

descr.p: GetNodeValue is a DOMString function used to get the value for the NodeValue property. It is overridden in descendent classes to provide the value needed for the DOM node specialization. In TDOMNode, the method always returns an empty string ('').

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNodeValue.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetNodeValue
element.short: Sets the value for the NodeValue property.

descr.p: SetNodeValue is a method used to set the NodeValue property to the value specified in AValue. It has an empty implementation in TDOMNode, and must be re-implemented in a descendent class to use the correct content for the DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetNodeValue.AValue
element.short: New value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetFirstChild
element.short: Gets the value for the FirstChild property.

descr.p: GetFirstChild always returns Nil for the property value. TDOMNode does not allocate storage for child nodes. The method must be re-implemented in a descendent class to which implements a DOM node specialization with child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetFirstChild.Result
element.short: Value for the FirstChild property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLastChild
element.short: Gets the value for the LastChild property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLastChild.Result
element.short: Value for the LastChild property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetAttributes
element.short: Gets the value for the Attributes property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetAttributes.Result
element.short: Value for the Attributes property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetRevision
element.short: Gets the revision number for the node.

descr.p: The value for the property is retrieved from the revision number in the OwnerDocument for the node instance.

GetRevision is called from methods in TDOMNodeList which compare the revision numbers for a given node and the node list where it is stored. When the revision numbers differ, the node list is refreshed by calling the BuildList method in the TDOMNodeList instance.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetRevision.Result
element.short: Revision number for the node.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetTextContent
element.short: Gets the value for the TextContent property.

descr.p: Returns the value from the NodeValue property in TDOMNode.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetTextContent.Result
element.short: Value for the TextContent property.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetTextContent
element.short: Sets the value in the TextContent property.

descr.p: Updates the value in NodeValue property in TDOMNode.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetTextContent.AValue
element.short: Value for the TextContent property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLocalName
element.short: Gets the value for the LocalName property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLocalName.Result
element.short: Value for the LocalName property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNamespaceURI
element.short: Gets the value for the NamespaceURI property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNamespaceURI.Result
element.short: Value for the NamespaceURI property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetPrefix
element.short: Gets the value for the Prefix property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetPrefix.Result
element.short: Value for the Prefix property.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetPrefix
element.short: Sets the value for the Prefix property.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetPrefix.Value
element.short: New value for the Prefix property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetOwnerDocument
element.short: Gets the value for the OwnerDocument property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetOwnerDocument.Result
element.short: Value for the OwnerDocument property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetBaseURI
element.short: Gets the value for the BaseURI property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetBaseURI.Result
element.short: Value for the BaseURI property.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetReadOnly
element.short: Updates the read-only Node flag for the DOM Node and its children.

element.name: TDOMNode.SetReadOnly.Value
element.short: New value for the node flag.

element.name: TDOMNode.Changing
element.short: Determines if the Node and its owner document can be modified.

descr.p: Changing is a procedure used to determine if the DOM node and its Owner document can be modified. Changing uses the Node Flags in the DOM node and its OwnerDocument to determine if the Node is marked as read-only and the document is not being freed.

errors.p: Raises an EDOMError with the DOM exception code NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR when the Node is marked as read-only.

element.name: TDOMNode.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Creates stores the TDOMDocument instance in AOwner as the OwnerDocument for the DOM node. Create calls the inherited constructor.

element.name: TDOMNode.Create.AOwner
element.short: Document that is the Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TDOMNode.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that the ParentNode is notified that the node will be removed from the tree structure. When ParentNode is assigned, its DetachChild method is called to remove the class instance from the ChildNodes hierarchy.
Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.FreeInstance
element.short: Performs actions needed to free the class instance.

descr.p: FreeInstance is an overridden procedure used to perform actions needed when the class instance is freed. FreeInstance ensures that information in the internal TNodePool custom memory manager is updated, and the node is freed from its node pool. If the internal node pool has not been assigned, the inherited FreeInstance method is called.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetChildNodes
element.short: Gets the value for the ChildNodes property.

descr.p: Calls the GetChildNodeList method in OwnerDocument to get the list of child nodes for the current class instance. The property value is an empty node list if there are no child nodes in the current node.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetChildNodes.Result
element.short: Value for the ChildNodes property.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetChildCount
element.short: Gets the number of Child nodes for the DOM node.

descr.p: Always returns 0 (zero) in TDOMNode. Overridden in descendent classes (like TDOMNode_WithChildren).

element.name: TDOMNode.GetChildCount.Result
element.short: Number of Child nodes for the DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNode.NodeName
element.short: Name for the DOM node.

descr.p: NodeName is a read-only DOMString property that contains the name for the DOM node. The read access specifier for the property is an abstract method in TDOMNode, and must be implemented in descendent classes to return the correct value for the DOM node specializations.
The values for NodeName, NodeValue, and Attributes vary according to the node type as follows:

element.name: TDOMNode.NodeValue
element.short: Value for the DOM node.

descr.p: NodeValue is a DOMString property that contains the value for the DOM node. Reading the value in NodeValue always results in an empty string ('') in TDOMNode, and writing the value for the property is not implemented. The access specifiers must be re-implemented in descendent classes to perform the actions required for the DOM node specializations.
The values for NodeName, NodeValue, and Attributes vary according to the node type as follows:

element.name: TDOMNode.NodeType
element.short: Node type for the DOM Node.

descr.p: NodeType is a read-only Integer property that represents the DOM node type as defined in the DOM specification. The read access specifier in TDOMNode is an abstract method, and must be implemented in a descendent class to return the correct value for the DOM node specializations.
DOM node specializations use the following values in the NodeType property:

element.name: TDOMNode.ParentNode
element.short: DOM node that is the immediate ancestor of this node.

descr.p: ParentNode is a read-only TDOMNode property that represents the DOM node that is the immediate ancestor of this node. All nodes, except TDOMAttr, TDOMDocument, TDOMDocumentFragment, TDOMEntity, and TDOMNotation may have a parent.

The value in ParentNode is assigned when TDOMNode methods like InsertBefore, InternalAppend, and AppendChild are called. The value in ParentNode is cleared when the DetachChild method is called, or when ChildNodes are freed.

Use ChildNodes to access the DOM nodes that are the immediate descendants of this node. Use PreviousSibling and NextSibling to access the respective DOM nodes that exist at the same Level in the DOM tree.

element.name: TDOMNode.FirstChild
element.short: Gets the first child node for the current node.

descr.p: FirstChild is a read-only TDOMNode property that represents the first child node for this DOM node. In TDOMNode, the value for the property is always Nil (not assigned). The read access specifier is re-implemented in a descendent class (TDOMNode_WithChildren) to provide direct support for child node access.

element.name: TDOMNode.LastChild
element.short: Gets the last child node for the current node.

descr.p: LastChild is a read-only TDOMNode property that represents the last child node for this DOM node. In TDOMNode, the value for the property is always Nil (not assigned). The read access specifier is re-implemented in a descendent class (TDOMNode_WithChildren) to provide direct support for child node access.

element.name: TDOMNode.ChildNodes
element.short: Provides access to the list of Child nodes for the current node.

descr.p: ChildNodes is a read-only TDOMNodeList property used to provide access to the child nodes for the current DOM node. Reading the value in ChildNodes causes a TDOMNodeList to be created using the DOM tree in OwnerDocument. The list contains any DOM nodes found in OwnerDocument immediately below the current DOM node. If there are no child nodes for the current node, the list has a Length (or Count - they contain the same data) of 0 (zero). Use HasChildNodes to determine if the ChildNodes property contains any DOM nodes.
descr.remark: While ChildNodes is specified in TDOMNode, actually support for the list of child nodes is implemented in the TDOMNode_WithChildren descendant.

element.name: TDOMNode.PreviousSibling
element.short: Previous DOM Node at the same level in the DOM tree.

descr.p: PreviousSibling is a read-only TDOMNode property that represents the previous DOM node at the same level in the DOM tree. If no previous node was found at the same level, the property is unassigned (contains Nil).
Use NextSibling to access the next node at the same level in the DOM tree.

element.name: TDOMNode.NextSibling
element.short: Next DOM Node at the same level in the DOM tree.

descr.p: NextSibling is a read-only TDOMNode property that represents the next DOM node at the same level in the DOM tree. If no successor node was found at the same level, the property is unassigned (contains Nil).
Use PreviousSibling to access the previous node at the same level in the DOM tree.

element.name: TDOMNode.Attributes
element.short: Contains Attribute for the DOM Node.

descr.p: Attributes is a read-only TDOMNamedNodeMap property that contains attributes for the DOM node. Use the properties and methods in Attributes to access the DOM nodes by their name or ordinal position. Attributes also includes properties and methods that provide support for Namespace URIs and QualifiedNames as defined in the DOM specification.
While specified in TDOMNode, Attributes are valid only in the TDOMElement node type. For all other DOM node types the Attributes property is unassigned (contains Nil).

element.name: TDOMNode.OwnerDocument
element.short: DOM Document that created the DOM node.

descr.p: OwnerDocument is a read-only TDOMDocument property that represents the DOM document that created the node. OwnerDocument can be used to get access to the complete DOM tree for a document, or to access child nodes for any DOM node owned by the OwnerDocument.
In the TDOMDocument node specialization, the value in OwnerDocument is always unassigned (contains Nil).

element.name: TDOMNode.GetEnumerator
element.short: Gets an enumerator for DOM Nodes that are top-level children in the node.

descr.p: GetEnumerator is a TDOMNodeEnumerator function used to get an enumerator for all top-level child nodes for the DOM node. It does not include any grandchildren (recursive access to child nodes).

element.name: TDOMNode.GetEnumerator.Result
element.short: Enumerator for immediate child nodes in the DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetEnumeratorAllChildren
element.short: Gets an enumerator for DOM Nodes that are children or grand children for the node.

descr.p: GetEnumeratorAllChildren is a TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator function used to get an enumerator for all nodes which are children or grandchildren for the node. Allows recursion into descendent nodes found in a child node.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetEnumeratorAllChildren.Result
element.short: Enumerator for all child nodes in the sub-tree for the DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNextNode
element.short: Gets the next Child or Sibling node for the DOM node.

descr.p: GetNextNode is a TDOMNode function used to get the next child or sibling node in the DOM node hierarchy. GetNextNode visits nodes starting at the FirstChild node for the class instance. If FirstChild is not assigned, the GetNextNodeSkipChildren method is called to get the NextSibling node, or the NextSibling node in the ParentNode.
The return value is the TDOMNode which represents the next child or sibling node in the document hierarchy.
GetNextNode is called from the TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.MoveNext method.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNextNode.Result
element.short: Next child or sibling node in the DOM hierarchy.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNextNodeSkipChildren
element.short: Gets the next sibling for the node in the DOM hierarchy.

descr.p: GetNextNodeSkipChildren is a TDOMNode function used to get the next sibling node, ignoring all child nodes, for the current node.

The return value contains the TDOMNode that is the NextSibling for the current node, and can actually contain a previous sibling if NextSibling is unassigned. The return value is Nil when NextSibling is unassigned for both the current node and ParentNode.
GetNextNodeSkipChildren is used in the implementation of the TDOMNodeAllChildEnumerator.Create method, and called from the TDOMNode.GetNextNode method.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetNextNodeSkipChildren.Result
element.short: Next sibling node in the DOM hierarchy, or Nil.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetPreviousNode
element.short: Gets the previous node in the DOM node hierarchy.

descr.p: GetPreviousNode is a TDOMNode function used to get the previous node in the DOM node hierarchy.

The return value contains the last node (or leaf) in the node hierarchy for the PreviousSibling node as return from the GetLastLeaf method for the node. The return value is the ParentNode when PreviousSibling is unassigned.
GetPreviousNode is the converse of the GetNextNode method.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetPreviousNode.Result
element.short: Previous node in the DOM node hierarchy.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLastLeaf
element.short: Gets the last node in the DOM sub-tree for the current node.

descr.p: GetLastLeaf is a TDOMNode function used to the last node in the DOM node hierarchy for the current node.
The return value is Nil when LastChild has not been assigned for the current node. Otherwise, LastChild is called recursively until the given descendent node has no child nodes.
GetLastLeaf is used to implement the GetPreviousNode method.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLastLeaf.Result
element.short: Last node in the DOM sub-tree for the current node.

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLevel
element.short: Gets the level in the DOM tree for the DOM node.

descr.p: GetLevel is a SizeInt function used to get the level for the current node in the DOM node hierarchy. The return value is determined by counting the number of ParentNode assignments starting with the current DOM node. A root-level node in a DOM document is at level 0 (zero).

element.name: TDOMNode.GetLevel.Result
element.short: Number of parent nodes found in the DOM node hierarchy.

element.name: TDOMNode.InsertBefore
element.short: Inserts a new child node immediately before the reference child node.

descr.p: InsertBefore is a TDOMNode function used to insert a new child node immediately before the referenced child node. In TDOMNode, InsertBefore always raises an EDOMHierarchyRequest exception. The method must be re-implemented in descendent classes which support child nodes in the DOM Node specialization.

element.errors: Raises an EDOMHierarchyRequest exception; must be re-implemented in descendent classes.

element.name: TDOMNode.InsertBefore.Result
element.short: DOM node inserted in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.InsertBefore.NewChild
element.short: New DOM node to insert into the child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode.InsertBefore.RefChild
element.short: Reference node where the new node is inserted.

element.name: TDOMNode.ReplaceChild
element.short: Replaces a child node with the specified DOM node.

descr.p: ReplaceChild is a TDOMNode function which specifies the method used to replace a child node in the DOM sub-tree with the specified DOM node. NewChild is the DOM node to store in the DOM sub-tree. OldChild is the existing DOM node replaced with the new node value.

While TDOMNode specifies the method, it does not provide physical storage for child nodes. As a result, ReplaceChild always raises an EDOMHierarchyRequest exception and the return value is always Nil. ReplaceChild must be re-implemented in a descendent class to provide the functionality required for other DOM node specializations.

element.name: TDOMNode.ReplaceChild.Result
element.short: Old child node replaced in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.ReplaceChild.NewChild
element.short: New node to store in child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode.ReplaceChild.OldChild
element.short: Old node to remove from the child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode.DetachChild
element.short: Detaches the specified child node from the DOM sub-tree for the node.

descr.p: DetachChild is a TDOMNode function used to detach a specified child node from the DOM sub-tree for the current node. OldChild is the DOM node to remove from the DOM sub-tree. The return value contains the detached DOM node.

TDOMNode specifies the DetachChild method, but does not provide physical storage for child nodes. As a result, it always raises an EDOMNotFound exception in the method. DetachChild must be re-implemented in a descendent class as required for other DOM Node specializations.

element.name: TDOMNode.DetachChild.Result
element.short: The DOM Node detached in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.DetachChild.OldChild
element.short: DOM Node to locate in the DOM sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode.RemoveChild
element.short: Removes the specified child from the DOM sub-tree for this node.

descr.p: RemoveChild is a TDOMNode function used to remove the node specified in OldChild from the ChildNodes sub-tree. RemoveChild calls the DetachChild method to detach the specified node from the OwnerDocument. The return value is the node in OldChild after it has been detached from the OwnerDocument and its internal node references have been updated.

element.name: TDOMNode.RemoveChild.Result
element.short: Child Node removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.RemoveChild.OldChild
element.short: DOM Node to locate in the DOM sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode.AppendChild
element.short: Appends the specified node as a child in the current node.

descr.p: AppendChild is a TDOMNode function used to append the node specified in NewChild as a child node in the hierarchy for the current class instance. AppendChild calls the InsertBefore method to make the specified node the first child node in the DOM hierarchy.
The return value contains the TDOMNode instance in NewChild after the node relationship in ParentNode, FirstChild, PreviousSibling, and NextSibling have been updated.
descr.remark: lnsertBefore always raises an EDOMHierarchyRequest exception in TDOMNode. It is overridden in descendent classes to perform actions needed for a DOM node specialization when the AppendChild method is called.

element.name: TDOMNode.AppendChild.Result
element.short: New DOM Node appended as a child node.

element.name: TDOMNode.AppendChild.NewChild
element.short: DOM Node to append in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.HasChildNodes
element.short: Indicates if the DOM node has child nodes.

descr.p: HasChildNodes is a Boolean function which indicates if the DOM node has child nodes. In general, the return value is True when a DOM node has been assigned to the FirstChild property.

HasChildNodes always returns False in TDOMNode. TDOMNode does not allocate storage for child nodes. The method must be overridden in a descendent class which allocates storage for child nodes in the DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNode.HasChildNodes.Result
element.short: True when the size of the ChildNodes list is not zero.

element.name: TDOMNode.CloneNode
element.short: Makes a copy of the DOM node.

descr.p: CloneNode is an overloaded TDOMNode function used to make a new copy of the current node. Deep indicates that child nodes are included in the new TDOMNode instance when set to True. An overloaded variant allows the DOM Document which owns the new node to be specified.

CloneNode always raises an EDOMNotSupported exception in TDOMNode, and the return value is always Nil. It must be overridden in a descendent class to perform any actions needed for the DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNode.CloneNode.Result
element.short: DOM node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.CloneNode.deep
element.short: Indicates if child nodes are included in the cloned node.

element.name: TDOMNode.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: DOM Document used to created the new DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsSupported
element.short: Indicates if the DOM implementation supports a specific feature at a given conformance level.

descr.p: IsSupported is a Boolean function which indicates whether the DOM implementation implements a specific feature and that feature is supported in this node. IsSupported implements the DOM Node method defined in the DOM Level 2 Specification.
Feature contains the name for the feature or module to check in the method.
Version contains the conformance level for the specified Feature. Both values are used as arguments to the TDOMImplementation.HasFeature method.
Returns True if the specified feature at the given conformance level is supported for the node, or false when not implemented.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsSupported.Result
element.short: True when the feature and version number are supported in the DOM implementation.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsSupported.Feature
element.short: Name of the feature or module to check in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsSupported.Version
element.short: Version number or conformance level required for the feature.

element.name: TDOMNode.HasAttributes
element.short: Indicates if the DOM node has attribute names and values.

descr.p: HasAttributes is a Boolean function which indicates if the DOM node attribute names and/or values. HasAttributes implements the method defined for the DOM Node interface in the DOM Level 2 Specification.
The return value is True when a TDOMNamedNodeMap has been assigned for the node, and it has a non-zero value in its Length (or Count) property.
descr.remark: HasAttributes always returns False in TDOMNode, and is overridden in descendent classes which implement a DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNode.HasAttributes.Result
element.short: True when the Attribute list is not empty.

element.name: TDOMNode.Normalize
element.short: Normalizes text nodes and attributes in the Node sub-tree.

descr.p: Normalize is a method used to convert child text nodes in the sub-tree to their normal form where only structure nodes separate the text nodes. Adjacent text nodes are combined into a single text node. Adjacent text nodes which contain only ignorable whitespace are consolidated into a single whitespace value.
Normalize implements the method defined for the DOM Node interface in the DOM Level 2 Specification.

element.name: TDOMNode.NamespaceURI
element.short: URI for the NameSpace assigned to the DOM Node.

descr.p: NamespaceURI is a read-only DOMString property with the Namespace URI (Universal Resource Identifier) for the DOM node, or an empty string when it has not been specified. NamespaceURI is determined using a namespace lookup for the value declared when the node is created.

For nodes other than node type ELEMENT_NODE (TDOMElement) and ATTRIBUTE_NODE (TDOMAttr), and nodes created with a DOM Level 1 method, such as createElement from the Document interface, this is always an empty DOMString.
The property value is always an empty string ('') in TDOMNode. In a descendent class (like TDOMNode_NS), it will contain one of the Namespace URLs registered in the OwnerDocument for the node.
NamespaceURI implements the attribute from the Node interface in the DOM Level 2 Specification.

element.name: TDOMNode.LocalName
element.short: Name without the NameSpace prefix assigned to the DOM Node.

descr.p: LocalName is a read-only DOMString property with the local part of the qualified name for the node. A qualified name consists of a delimited namespace Prefix and the name for the element or attribute in the node. Local name contains only the element or attribute name, without the Prefix for the namespace.
For the following Qualified Names:
The Prefix values are:
The LocalName values are:

For nodes other than ELEMENT_NODE (TDOMELement) and ATTRIBUTE_NODE (TDOMAttr), and nodes created with a DOM Level 1 method, such as createElement from the Document interface, the property value is is always an empty DOMString.
The property value is always an empty DOMString value in TDOMNode. In a descendent class (like TDOMNode_NS), it will contain the actual NodeName for an element or attribute.

element.name: TDOMNode.Prefix
element.short: Prefix used for the assigned NameSpace in the DOM Node.

descr.p: Prefix is a DOMString property which contains the prefix part of a qualified name used for the node. Prefix is the identifier used for the namespace URI, and is included in the value for the NodeName property which includes the qualified name. When a qualified name is not used in NodeName, Prefix contains an empty DOMString value (''). Use LocalName for the value in NodeName without the value in Prefix.

Prefix applies to the DOM Element and Attribute node types. For nodes of any type other than ELEMENT_NODE (TDOMElement) and ATTRIBUTE_NODE (TDOMAttr) and nodes created with a DOM Level 1 method, such as createElement from the Document interface, this is always an empty DOMString value.
Prefix implements the Prefix attribute for the DOM Node interface in the DOM Level 2 Specification.

element.name: TDOMNode.TextContent
element.short: Textual representation for the DOM Node.

descr.p: TextContent is a DOMString property the textual content for a DOM node (and its specialized descendants), as specified in the DOM Level 3 specification.

In TDOMNode, the value in TextContent is redirected to the NodeValue property. The read and write access specifiers may be overridden in descendent classes to perform actions needed for a particular DOM Node specialization, including:

element.name: TDOMNode.LookupPrefix
element.short: Locates the Prefix for the specified NameSpace URI.

descr.p: LookupPrefix is a DOMString function used to locate the Prefix associated with the NameSpace URI specified in the nsURI argument. LookupPrefix implements the DOM Node interface specified in the DOM Level 3 specification.

In TDOMNode, the return value is always an empty DOMString (''). Descendent classes which implement a specific DOM Node specialization (like TDOMElement) will provide an InternalLookupPrefix method used to get the return value. The internal GetAncestorElement routine is used to find Prefix / Namespace associations in ancestor nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode.LookupPrefix.Result
element.short: Prefix for the Namespace URI, or an empty string.

element.name: TDOMNode.LookupPrefix.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI to locate in the Namespace information.

element.name: TDOMNode.LookupNamespaceURI
element.short: Locates the NameSpace URI for the specified Prefix.

descr.p: LookupNamespaceURI is a DOMString function used to get the NamespaceURI associated with the Prefix specified in the APrefix argument. LookupNamespaceURI implements the method for the DOM Node interface as specified in the DOM Level 3 specification.

LookupNamespaceURI ensures that the DOM node uses the ELEMENT_NODE node type required for namespace support. If the node is not a DOM Element (TDOMElement), the ancestor nodes are checked for a TDOMDocument or TDOMAttrib node which can supply the namespace information.

LookupNamespaceURI compares the value in the Prefix property to the argument in APrefix. When a match is found, the NamespaceURI for the node is used as the return value. When a namespace is not found for the prefix, the return value is an empty DOMString ('').
descr.remark: This method is not fully compatible with the DOM Level 3 specification which allows the APrefix argument to contain a Null value. Lazarus cannot represent the DOMString type in that manner, so it uses an empty DOMString ('').

element.name: TDOMNode.LookupNamespaceURI.Result
element.short: The Namespace URI for the specified Prefix, or an empty string.

element.name: TDOMNode.LookupNamespaceURI.APrefix
element.short: Prefix to locate in the Namespace Information for the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsDefaultNamespace
element.short: Indicates if the specified NameSpace URI is the default namespace for the DOM node.

descr.p: IsDefaultNamespace is a Boolean function which indicates if the Namespace URI in the nsURI argument is the default value for the DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsDefaultNamespace.Result
element.short: True when the default Namespace is the specified Namespace URI.

element.name: TDOMNode.IsDefaultNamespace.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI to examine in the Namespace Information for the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNode.baseURI
element.short: Provides the BaseURI for the node relative to its Owner document.

descr.p: BaseURI is a read-only DOMString property with the Base Universal Resource Identifier (URI) for the node relative to its context.
BaseURI is specified in the DOM Level 3 Specification. It is not defined in the DOM Level 2 APIs. The implementation in TDOMNode is incomplete as per the DOM Level 3 specification.

In the DOM specification, BaseURI is a dynamically computed value starting with the xml:base attribute for a given document. It includes the DocumentURI for the owner document, and should also include the node path to the current node.

In TDOMNode, BaseURI is resolved to the DocumentURI in the OwnerDocument when the node type is a document node or a processing instruction. It does not include the xml:base attribute that may (or may not ) be present in the owner document.
For all other node types, the property value is an empty string ('').

element.name: TDOMNode.FindNode
element.short: Finds the Child Node with the specified name.

descr.p: FindNode is a TDOMNode function used to locate a child node in the class instance with the value in ANodeName in its NodeName property. The return value contains the TDOMNode instance with the specified name, or Nil if a node is not found with the specified name.

FindNode always returns Nil in TDOMNode since physical storage is not allocated in TDOMNode for child node instances. It must be overridden in a descendent class to performs actions needed for the DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNode.FindNode.Result
element.short: DOM Node located with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMNode.FindNode.ANodeName
element.short: Node Name to locate in the Child Nodes for the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNode.CompareName
element.short: Compares the NodeName in the DOM Node to the specified value.

descr.p: CompareName is an Integer function used to compare the value in NodeName to the value specified in the name argument. NodeName and name are converted to DOMPChar types and passed as arguments an implementation routine used to compare the values.

The return value contains the difference between the ordinal character values for the first non-matching characters in the compared names. When the return value is 0 (zero), the compared values have the same content.

element.name: TDOMNode.CompareName.Result
element.short: Difference between the ordinal character values for the first non-matching character in the compared names.

element.name: TDOMNode.CompareName.name
element.short: Value compared to the NodeName for the DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNode.Flags
element.short: Provides access to the Node Flags for the DOM Node.

descr.p: Flags is a TNodeFlags property which contains zero or more values from the TNodeFlagEnum enumeration that indicate the conformance level or state for the node. See TNodeFlagEnum for more information about the values in the enumeration and their meanings.
Values in Flags are used and updated in various methods like Normalize and GetTextContent. It is also updated when the SetReadOnly method is called.

element.name: TDOMNodeClass
element.short: Class type used to create TDOMNode instances.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren
element.short: Extends TDOMNode to allocate storage for child nodes.

descr.p: TDOMNode_WithChildren is a TDOMNode descendant which allocates storage for child nodes in the class instance. TDOMNode_WithChildren is an extension to the Node interface in the DOM specification, and is designed to save memory in a large DOM tree.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.GetFirstChild
element.short: Gets the value for the FirstChild property.

descr.p: GetFirstChild is an overridden method in TDOMNode_WithChildren used to get the value for the FirstChild property.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.GetFirstChild.Result
element.short: DOM Node that is the first child node in the DOM sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.GetLastChild
element.short: Gets the value for the LastChild property.

descr.p: GetLastChild is an overridden method in TDOMNode_WithChildren used to get the value for the LastChild property.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.GetLastChild.Result
element.short: Value for the LastChild property.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.CloneChildren
element.short: Makes a copy of child nodes in the specified DOM node.

descr.p: CloneChildren is a method used to clone child nodes from the current class instance to DOM node specified in ACopy.

CloneChildren visits each of the child nodes, starting at FirstChild and continuing to the value in the NextSibling property for the child node. The CloneNode method for each child node is called make a new copy (including its children) that is owned by the document in ACloneOwner. The cloned node is added to ACopy using the InternalAppend method.
No actions are performed in the method when the FirstChild property has not been assigned in the class instance.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.CloneChildren.ACopy
element.short: DOM Node which receives the cloned child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.CloneChildren.ACloneOwner
element.short: DOM Document used to create the cloned child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.FreeChildren
element.short: Frees all Child nodes for the DOM node.

descr.p: FreeChildren is a method used to free all child nodes in the current class instance.

FreeChildren visits each of the child nodes, starting at FirstChild and continuing to the NextSibling for the child node. The TDOMNode instance that is the child is freed before continuing to the next sibling node.
FreeChildren sets the value in the FirstChild and LastChild properties to Nil prior to exit.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.GetTextContent
element.short: Gets the value for the TextContent property.

descr.p: GetTextContent is an overridden method in TDOMNode_WithChildren used to get the value for the TextContent property. It re-implements the method to ensure that child nodes are represented in the value for the property.

Child nodes are processed, start at FirstChild and continuing to the NextSibling for the child node. The NodeType property for each child node is used to determine the actions needed for the node type. For example:

dl.dd: Casts the child node to TDOMText and appends its Data to the value for the property (when it is not ignorable whitespace).
These child node types are omitted from the property value.
The TextContent property for the child node is appended to the property value.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.GetTextContent.Result
element.short: Value for the TextContent property.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.SetTextContent
element.short: Sets the value for the TextContent property.

descr.p: SetTextContent is a overridden method used to set the TextContent property to the value specified in AValue. TextContent is the textual representation of the content for the node as a single TDOMText child node.

SetTextContent calls the Changing method to ensure that the node does not have the value nfReadonly in its Flags property. An EDOMError exception is raised with the NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR constant if the node is marked as read-only.
SetTextContent removes existing ChildNodes by calling DetachChild until FirstChild is no longer assigned.
If AValue is not an empty string (''), the OwnerDocument is used to create a TDOMText node with the specified value. The new text node is added to ChildNodes using the AppendChild method.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.SetTextContent.AValue
element.short: New value for the TextContent property.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It calls FreeChildren to free all of the ChildNodes for the class instance, and frees the node list as well. Destroy calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.InsertBefore
element.short: Inserts a new child node immediately before the reference child node.

descr.p: InsertBefore is a TDOMNode function used to insert a new child node immediately before the reference child node. InsertBefore is an overridden function that re-implements the method defined in the ancestor class.

NewChild contains the Node inserted into the DOM sub-tree for the current DOM Node. RefChild contains the Node that establishes the position where the NewChild Node is inserted in the DOM sub-tree. When RefChild is not assigned (contains Nil), the new child node is appended as a sibling in the DOM sub-tree. No actions are performed in the method when NewChild and RefChild contains the same DOM node.

InsertBefore uses the value in the NodeType property for the NewChild node to determine the actions needed to add the node to the DOM sub-tree. NodeType determines if NewChild requires additional processing before it is added to the DOM sub-tree. Some DOM Node types cannot be added directly to the sub-tree. Only their child nodes are added. No actions are performed for these DOM Node specialization when they do not contain child nodes. InsertBefore raises an EDOMHierarchyRequest exception if ChildNode is not a valid child node type for the current DOM node.

InsertBefore updates the parent, sibling, and child relationships in DOM nodes as they are inserted (or appended) to the DOM sub-tree. The return value contains the NewChild argument with updated values in its ParentNode, PreviousSibling and NextSibling properties.

InsertBefore checks the ParentNode for the RefChild argument to ensure that it resides in the DOM sub-tree for the current DOM Node. An EDOMNotFound exception is raised when it has an assigned value other than the current DOM Node.

InsertBefore calls the Changing method to ensure that neither the current DOM Node nor its ancestor have their read-only Flags set. An exception is raised in Changing if Flags contains the value nfReadonly in either DOM Node.
When the NodeType is DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE, the OwnerDocument property is examined. An EDOMWrongDocument exception is raised when the NewChild has an assigned value in the OwnerDocument property.

dl.dd: Raised when the OwnerDocument for the current node is not the same as the value in NewChild
Raised when the assigned ParentNode in RefChild is not the same as the current DOM node
Raised when NewChild is not a valid child node type for the current DOM node

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.InsertBefore.Result
element.short: DOM Node inserted into the DOM sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.InsertBefore.NewChild
element.short: Child node inserted in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.InsertBefore.RefChild
element.short: Reference child node where the new DOM node is inserted as a Sibling.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.ReplaceChild
element.short: Replaces a child DOM node with another DOM node.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.ReplaceChild.Result
element.short: DOM node in OldChild after it has been detached from the node sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.ReplaceChild.NewChild
element.short: New DOM node to store in the sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.ReplaceChild.OldChild
element.short: Old DOM node replaced in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.DetachChild
element.short: Detached the specified DOM node from the sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.DetachChild.Result
element.short: Returns OldChild after updating the Parent, children, and siblings for the node.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.DetachChild.OldChild
element.short: DOM node detached in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.HasChildNodes
element.short: Indicates if the current DOM node has child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.HasChildNodes.Result
element.short: True if FirstChild has been assigned for the node.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.FindNode
element.short: Finds a DOM node with the specified value in its NodeName property.

descr.p: FindNode is a method used to search the child nodes in class instance for the node with the name specified in ANodeName. The search is started using the node in FirstChild, and calls the CompareName method to compare the value in ANodeNode to the NodeName property for each child node.

The return value contains the first TDOMNode with a node name that matches the requested value. The return value is Nil if a node is not found that matches the requested value, or when the class instance does not have any child nodes.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.FindNode.Result
element.short: DOM node with a name matching the requested value, or Nil.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.FindNode.ANodeName
element.short: Name for the DOM node to locate in the method.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.InternalAppend
element.short: Performs actions needed to append the specified node to the ChildNodes.

descr.p: InternalAppend is a method used to perform actions needed to append the DOM node specified in NewChild to the child nodes for the class instance.
If the node has child nodes, as indicated by a value in FirstChild, PreviousSibling and NextSibling properties for the nodes are updated to reflect the new relationship in the node hierarchy.
If the node does not have any existing child nodes, the value in NewChild is assigned to the FirstChild property.
In both cases, NewChild is used as the LastChild for the class instance.
InternalAppend ensures that the ParentNode in NewChild is set to the current class instance.
InternalAppend is used in the implementation of the CloneChildren method.

element.name: TDOMNode_WithChildren.InternalAppend.NewChild
element.short: New DOM Node appended to the DOM sub-tree.

element.name: TFilterResult
element.short: Determines the Node types included in a DOM node list.

descr.p: TFilterResult is an enumerated type with values that determine the nodes selected in a TDOMNodeList instance.

element.name: TFilterResult.frFalse
element.short: Do not accept any nodes

element.name: TFilterResult.frNorecurseFalse
element.short: Accept all nodes and allow recursion.

element.name: TFilterResult.frTrue
element.short: Accept all nodes.

element.name: TFilterResult.frNorecurseTrue
element.short: Accept all nodes but don't allow recursion.

element.name: TDOMNodeList
element.short: Implements an ordered list of DOM Nodes.

descr.p: TDOMNodeList is a class used to Implement an ordered list of DOM nodes, as required in the DOM specification. TDOMNodeList provides internal storage for TDOMNode instances that are children of a specified DOM node. DOM nodes stored in TDOMNodeList are "live"; changes made to a DOM node in the list are automatically propagated to the DOM Document tree.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.GetCount
element.short: Gets the value for the Count and Length properties.

descr.p: GetCount is a LongWord function used to the get value for the Count and Length properties. Calls the BuildList method to refresh the nodes in the list when the revision number for the list does not match the revision number for the node which owns the list.
The property value contains the Count for the internal TFPList instance used to store the TDOMNode instances.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.GetItem
element.short: Gets the value for the Item property.

descr.p: GetItem is a TDOMNode function used to get the value for the indexed Item property. Index contains the ordinal position in the list for the property value.

GetItem ensures that items in the internal TFPList instance are up-to-date. When the revision number for the list differs from the revision number for the node that owns the list, the BuildList method is called to refresh its contents and apply the node filtering mechanism for the container.
The return value contains the TDOMNode instance at the specified position in the list. The return value is Nil when Index contains a value not present in the internal list.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.GetItem.Result
element.short: Value for the Item property.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.GetItem.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the DOM node in the property value.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.NodeFilter
element.short: Determines if the node can be used in the DOM node list.

descr.p: NodeFilter is a TFilterResult function used to determine if the DOM node specified in ANode can be included in the DOM Node list. The return value indicates whether the node is allowed, and also whether its child nodes can be examined as well.

NodeFilter always returns frNoRecurseTrue in TDOMNodeList, and allows the node but does not allow recursion into its child nodes. The method is overridden in descendent classes to perform the actions needed for the DOM node specialization.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.NodeFilter.Result
element.short: Indicates if the node is included in the node list.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.NodeFilter.aNode
element.short: DOM Node to examine in the method.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.BuildList
element.short: Fills the node list using the node filter.

descr.p: BuildList is a virtual method used to get the TDOMNode instances in the node list. BuildList is called when the revision numbers for the node list and the node which owns the node list have different values. This ensures that the node list always reflects the current content in the DOM node hierarchy.

BuildList clears the internal TFPList instance where the DOM nodes are stored, and updates the internal revision number for the node list to match the value in the owner node. Child nodes for the owner node are visited, and the NodeFilter method is called to determine if the child node should be included in the node list. If the return value from NodeFilter indicates that recursion is allowed, the child nodes for each child node are also visited and examined.
descr.remark: BuildList is marked as deprecated in TDOMNode. Use NodeFilter instead.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry.

Create stores the DOM node in ANode as the owner for the node list, and "touches" the internal revision number for the list so that it is refreshed on its next access. Create also allocates the internal TFPList instance used to store the nodes in the node list.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Create.ANode
element.short: DOM Node which provides the child nodes for the list.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It ensures that the internal list storage is set to Nil before the class instance is freed. Destroy calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Item
element.short: Provides indexed access to DOM nodes in the list.

descr.p: Item is a read-only indexed TDOMNode property used to provide access to DOM nodes in the list by their ordinal position. Item is the default property for the class instance.

Index contains the ordinal position for the requested TDOMNode instance, and should be in the range 0..Count-1. The property value is Nil if Index contains a value which is not a valid position in the list.
Use Count (or Length) to get the number of DOM nodes available in the list.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Item.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested DOM Node in the list.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Count
element.short: Number of DOM nodes stored in the list.

descr.p: Count is a read-only LongWord property with the number of TDOMNode instances available in the Item property. Reading the value for the property causes the BuildList method to be called when the internal revision number for the list differs from the value in the DOM node that owns the list. The property value is re-directed to the Count property for the internal TFPList instance in the class.
Count and Length are synonymous. Count is the property name used in FPC / Lazarus classes. Length is the term used in the specification for the DOM interface. Both are provided for completeness.

element.name: TDOMNodeList.Length
element.short: Number of DOM Nodes stored in the list.

descr.p: Count and Length are synonymous. Count is the property name used in FPC / Lazarus classes. Length is the term used in the specification for the DOM interface. Both are provided for completeness.

element.name: TDOMElementList
element.short: Provides a recursive list of DOM Elements.

descr.p: TDOMElementList is a TDOMNodeList descendant that provides an extension to the DOM interface used to build recursive lists of elements. TDOMElementList provides optional filtering used to select the DOM Elements that appear in the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.filter
element.short: Member with the value for the filter applied to the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.FNSIndexFilter
element.short: Member with the index of the NameSpace for the filter.

element.name: TDOMElementList.localNameFilter
element.short: Member with the local name used to filter nodes in the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.UseFilter
element.short: Indicates if filtering is used when selecting DOM Elements in the list.

descr.p: UseFilter is a Boolean member used to indicate whether filtering is enabled to select the elements in the list. The value is set in the Create method, and contains True when the filter or local name argument has a value other than '*' (All elements). UseFilter is used in NodeFilter to determine the TFilterResult return value from the method.

element.name: TDOMElementList.NodeFilter
element.short: Determines if the node can be used in the DOM element list.

descr.p: NodeFilter is an overridden TFilterResult function used to determine if the DOM node specified in ANode can be included in the DOM Element list. The return value indicates whether the node is allowed in the element list.
NodeFilter re-implements the method defined in the ancestor class to check whether the DOM Node in ANode has ELEMENT_NODE in its NodeType property.

If the Element list was created with a Namespace URI argument, the Namespace Information for the list is used to get the return value. It is set to True when the LocalName for the node matches the qualified name in the Namespace Information.

If the Element list was created using a tag name as a filter, the return value is True when the TagName property in the node contains the same value. It is also True when the filter value was set to '*' for any element.
The return value is always False if the specified node is not a DOM Element.
NodeFilter is called from the inherited BuildList method.

element.name: TDOMElementList.NodeFilter.Result
element.short: True if the specified node matches the tag name filter for the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.NodeFilter.aNode
element.short: DOM Node to include or exclude using the Filter value.

element.name: TDOMElementList.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overloaded constructor for the class instance. The overloaded variants allow either a filter value, or a namespace URI and and a local name to be used to filter the nodes in the class instance.
Create updates the values in the Filter, LocalNameFilter, and UseFilter members based on the overloaded variant called to create the class instance.

element.name: TDOMElementList.Create.ANode
element.short: DOM Node with children for the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.Create.AFilter
element.short: Filter to apply to values in the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.Create.nsURI
element.short: NamedSpace URI for values in the list.

element.name: TDOMElementList.Create.localName
element.short: LocalName for values in the list.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap
element.short: Implements the NamedNodeMap interface in the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMNamedNodeMap is a class used to implement the NamedNodeMap interface in the DOM specification.TDOMNamedNodeMap is used as a collection of DOM Nodes that are accessed by their name or their ordinal position. TDOMNamedNodeMap provides support for the Namespace URIs and QualifiedNames in the collection, as required for DOM Level 2 conformance.

The DOM specification mandates unordered access to nodes in the collection. The sorting options available in TDOMNamedNodeMap are an extension to the DOM specification. To achieve this, the class uses two separate internal lists to represent the nodes in their sorted and unsorted orders. This most certainly requires additional memory and processing, but the overhead is minimal in comparison to the derived benefit.
TDOMNamedNodeMap is the type used to represent Attributes, Entities, and Notations in the DOM API. The TAttributeMap implementation class is used for namespace-enabled node maps.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetPosItem
element.short: Gets the value for the Item property.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetPosItem.Result
element.short: Value for the Item property.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetPosItem.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the Item.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetSortedItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed SortedItem property.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetSortedItem.Result
element.short: Value for the SortedItem property.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetSortedItem.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the node in the sorted item list.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetLength
element.short: Gets the value for the Length property.

descr.p: Ensures that the internal TFPList instance has been allocated for the positional list. The return value is 0 (zero) when the list has not been allocated.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetLength.Result
element.short: Value for the Length property.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.FindSorted
element.short: Finds a DOM Node with the specified name in the sorted container.

descr.p: Name is a DOMString value with the name for the DOM node to locate in the SortedItem container.
Index is an output parameter where the ordinal position in the sorted list is stored. The value is 0 (zero) if a DOM node with the specified name is not found in the sorted container.
The return value is True when a TDOMNode instance is located with the specified name. The return value is False if a DOM node with the specified name is not found in the sorted container.
Calls the CompareName method for each TDOMNode instance to compare the value in name to the NodeName property for the node.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.FindSorted.Result
element.short: True if a node with the specified name is found in the sorted list.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.FindSorted.name
element.short: Name to locate in the sorted list.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.FindSorted.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the node in the sorted list.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.DeleteSorted
element.short: Deletes the DOM node at the specified position in the sorted list of nodes.

descr.p: DeleteSorted is a TDOMNode function used to delete the node at the position specified in Index from the sorted list of nodes.
The return value contains the TDOMNode instance deleted in the method. The node is also removed from the positional list used for the Item property.
When node type indicates that the node is an Attribute node, the OwnerElement in the return value is set to Nil.
DeleteSorted is called from the InternalRemove method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.DeleteSorted.Result
element.short: DOM node instance deleted in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.DeleteSorted.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the node removed from the sorted node list.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.RestoreDefault
element.short: Restores the default value for the attribute node with the specified name.

descr.p: RestoreDefault is a method used to restore the default value for the attribute with the name specified in the name argument.

RestoreDefault ensures the Node type for the map is set to ATTRIBUTE_NODE. No actions performed in the method if the Node type for the map is not set to Attribute nodes. In addition, no actions are performed when the owner node does not have namespace information with the default value for the specified attribute name.

RestoreDefault calls the GetAttributeNode method in the owner Element to retrieve the attribute with the specified name. When assigned, and the attribute default value is "fixed" or "specified", it is re-applied to the attribute.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.RestoreDefault.name
element.short: Name of the item updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.InternalRemove
element.short: Performs actions need to remove an attribute node with the specified name.

descr.p: Calls the FindSorted method to locate the DOM node with the specified name. The return value is the TDOMNode instance removed in the method after the OwnerElement for the attribute has be cleared. The return value is Nil if node with the specified name is not found in the node map.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.InternalRemove.Result
element.short: DOM node for the attribute removed in the method, or Nil when not found.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.InternalRemove.name
element.short: Name of the attribute node affected in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.ValidateInsert
element.short: Performs actions to determine if an inserted attribute node is valid for its context.

descr.p: ValidateInsert is an Integer function used to determine if the DOM node in arg is valid for the context where it is used. The return value represents a specific error condition when set to a non-zero value.
For example:

dl.dd: nfReadOnly is included in the Flags for the owner node.
The node in arg has a different owner document than the node which owns the map.
The node in arg has a different node type than the node type for the map.
The map is for Attribute nodes and the owner Element in arg does not match the owner Element for the map.

descr.p: ValidateInsert is called from the TDOMNamedNodeMap.SetNamedItem method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.ValidateInsert.Result
element.short: Numeric value reflecting an error condition, or 0 when valid.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.ValidateInsert.arg
element.short: DOM node examined in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Create stores values passed in the AOwner and ANodeType arguments to members in the class instance.
AOwner is the DOM node which owns the entities, notations, or attributes maintained in the node map.

NodeType is the Integer value that indicates the value for the TDOMNode instances stored in the node map. NodeType should contain one of the values: ENTITY_NODE, NOTATION_NODE, or ATTRIBUTE_NODE. It is not validated in the constructor.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Create.ANodeType
element.short: DOM Node type for the entries in the map.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It ensures that DOM nodes in internal TFPList instances in the class are freed. It also frees the TFPList class instances. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetNamedItem
element.short: Gets the item with the specified name.

descr.p: Calls FindSorted to locate the node with the specified name. The return value is Nil if a node with the specified name is not found in the SortedItem property for the map.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetNamedItem.Result
element.short: Item with the specified name, or Nil when not found.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.GetNamedItem.name
element.short: Name to locate in the Items for the map.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.SetNamedItem
element.short: Sets the value for a named item to the specified node.

descr.p: SetNamedItem is a TDOMNode function used to store the named node in arg in the node map. This may require inserting a new entry or updating an existing one.

SetNamedItem calls ValidateInsert to determine whether the node is valid, and the parent for the node map is updatable. If the response code contains a non-zero value, an EDOMError exception is raised with the response code as the error constant.

SetNamedItem calls the FindSorted method to get the ordinal position for the node in arg. If a node with the same name already exists, it is replaced. Otherwise, the node is inserted at the position needed in the sorted node list.

The node type, passed as an argument to the constructor, is used to determine whether additional actions are needed to update the node / node map. For attribute nodes (TDomAttr), the OwnerElement is cleared in the old node (when needed). The OwnerElement in the new node is set to the DOM element which owns the attribute.
The return value is set to Nil if the node in arg was added to the map. Otherwise, the return value contains the node which was replaced.
SetNamedItem is called from methods like SetAttributeNode and SetAttributeNodeNS in TDOMElement.
Use GetNamedItem to retrieve a node from the map with a specified name.
