element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.SetNamedItem.Result
element.short: Node replaced in the named node map, or Nil when the node was added.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.SetNamedItem.arg
element.short: Node with the name and value added/updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.RemoveNamedItem
element.short: Removes the node with the specified name.

descr.p: RemoveNamedItem is a TDOMNode function used to remove the node with the name specified in the name argument. RemoveNamedItem calls the InternalRemove method to locate and remove the node from the map, and possibly restore the default value for a DOM Attribute node.
The return value contains the DOM node removed from the SortedItem property.

dl.dd: Raised with the error constant NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR when the Owner is marked as read-only.
Raised if a node with the specified name is not found in the node map.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.RemoveNamedItem.Result
element.short: The DOM node removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.RemoveNamedItem.name
element.short: Name for the DOM node removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.getNamedItemNS
element.short: Gets the Item with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.getNamedItemNS.Result
element.short: Namespaced node located in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.getNamedItemNS.namespaceURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the namespaced node.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.getNamedItemNS.localName
element.short: Local name for the namespaced node.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.setNamedItemNS
element.short: Sets a namespaced node to the specified value.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.setNamedItemNS.Result
element.short: Namespaced node replaced in the node map, or Nil when the node was added.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.setNamedItemNS.arg
element.short: Node with the namespace URI, local name, and value added/updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.removeNamedItemNS
element.short: Remove a DOM Node with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.removeNamedItemNS.Result
element.short: Always Nil in TDOMNamedNodeMap.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.removeNamedItemNS.namespaceURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the item removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.removeNamedItemNS.localName
element.short: Local name for the item removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Item
element.short: Provides indexed access to the unsorted DOM Nodes in the container.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Item.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.SortedItem
element.short: Provides indexed access to the sorted DOM Nodes in the container.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.SortedItem.index
element.short: Ordinal position for the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNamedNodeMap.Length
element.short: Indicates the Length of the container.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData
element.short: Implements the CharacterData interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMCharacterData is a TDOMNode descendant that implements the CharacterData interface from the DOM specification. TDOMCharacterData provides properties and methods used to access and manipulate character data in the DOM APIs.
descr.remark: Methods which alter character data use 0-based offsets; the offset values are converted internally to the 1-based offsets used in FPC / Lazarus.
descr.p: TDOMCharacterData is the ancestor class for other DOM Node specializations like TDOMText and TDOMComment. TDOMCharacterData is not used directly. Use one of the descendent classes.
Use TDOMCDATASection for the CDATA interface defined in the DOM specification.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.GetLength
element.short: Gets the value for the Length property.

descr.p: The property value is the length of the content in the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.GetLength.Result
element.short: Value for the Length property.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.GetNodeValue
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.GetNodeValue.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.SetNodeValue
element.short: Sets the value for the NodeValue property.

descr.p: SetNodeValue is an overridden method in TDOMCharacterData used to set the value for the NodeValue property.

SetNodeValue calls the Changing method to ensure that the node does not have the read-only attribute in its Flags property, or the OwnerDocument is not being freed. Either situation causes an EDOMError exception to raised.
SetNodeValue sets the internal member for the property to the specified value.

element.errors: Raises an EDOMError exception if the node is marked as read-only, or the OwnerDocument for the node is being destroyed.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.SetNodeValue.AValue
element.short: Value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.Data
element.short: Provides access to the character data in the NodeValue property.

descr.p: Data is a DOMString property with the character data for the class instance. Setting a new value for the property causes the SetNodeValue method to be called.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.Length
element.short: Length of the character data for the class instance.

descr.p: Length is a read-only LongWord property with the length of the character data in the class instance. The property value contains the length for the content in the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.SubstringData
element.short: Copies character data at the specified offset for the number of bytes requested.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.SubstringData.Result
element.short: Byte values copied from the NodeValue.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.SubstringData.offset
element.short: Offset to start copying character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.SubstringData.count
element.short: Number of bytes to copy from the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.AppendData
element.short: Appends the specified value to the end of the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.AppendData.arg
element.short: Value to append to the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.InsertData
element.short: Inserts the specified value at the given offset in the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.InsertData.offset
element.short: Offset in the character data where the value is inserted.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.InsertData.arg
element.short: Value inserted into the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.DeleteData
element.short: Deletes a given number of characters at the specified offset in the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.DeleteData.offset
element.short: Offset in the character data where values are deleted.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.DeleteData.count
element.short: Number of characters to delete from the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.ReplaceData
element.short: Replaces the characters at the specified offset in the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.ReplaceData.offset
element.short: Offset where characters are replace in the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.ReplaceData.count
element.short: Number of characters to remove from the character data.

element.name: TDOMCharacterData.ReplaceData.arg
element.short: Characters to insert into the character data at the specified offset.

element.name: TDOMImplementation
element.short: Implements the DOMImplementation interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMImplementation is a class which implements the DOMImplementation interface from the DOM specification. TDOMImplementation provides methods which perform operations that do not require an existing TDOMDocument class instance, such as creating new TDOMDocumentType or TDOMDocument instances. TDOMImplementation implements the HasFeature method which determines if the DOM implementation supports specific features required to conform to a specific DOM level.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.HasFeature
element.short: Indicates if a feature or module is supported in the DOM implementation.

descr.p: HasFeature is a Boolean function which implements the method from the DOMImplementation interface in the DOM Level 2 specification. HasFeature indicates if a feature or module is supported at the specified conformance level for the DOM implementation.
feature contains the name for the feature or module examined in the method.
version is the version number or conformance level needed for the feature.
HasFeature recognizes the following feature names and version numbers in TDOMImplementation:

dl.dd: Version numbers '2.0' or '' (empty string)
Version numbers '1.0', '2.0', or '' (empty string)

descr.p: The return value is True if the specified feature is supported at the requested version number.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.HasFeature.Result
element.short: True when the requested feature is supported at the required version.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.HasFeature.feature
element.short: Feature or module name to examine in the method.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.HasFeature.version
element.short: Version number or support level required for the feature.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocumentType
element.short: Creates a DOM Document Type using the specified arguments.

descr.p: CreateDocumentType is a method used to create an instance of a DOM Document Type. CreateDocumentType implements the method specified for the DOMImplementation interface in the DOM Level 2 specification.

Create ensures that the value in the QualifiedName argument is a valid XML Name, including its use of 'xml' or 'xmlns' prefixes in the name token. If QualifiedName is not valid, an EDOMError exception is raised.
CreateDocumentType returns a TDOMDocumentType instance with the values from the QualifiedName, PublicID, and SystemID parameters assigned to its Name, PublicID, and SystemID properties.
Use CreateDocumentType to create the optional DTD instance passed as an argument to the CreateDocument method, and assigned as the DocType property in the new Document.

element.errors: Raises an EDOMError exception if an invalid value is specified in the QualifiedName argument.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocumentType.Result
element.short: TDOMDocumentType created in the method.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocumentType.QualifiedName
element.short: Qualified name used in the DOM Document type.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocumentType.PublicID
element.short: Public ID for the DOM Document type.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocumentType.SystemID
element.short: System ID for the DOM Document type.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocument
element.short: Creates a new DOM Document instance.

descr.p: CreateDocument is a TDOMDocument function used to create a new DOM Document instance.
CreateDocument implements the method defined for the DOMImplementation interface in the DOM Level 2 specification. It creates a TXMLDocument instance that is used as the return value for the method.
The NamespaceURI and QualifiedName arguments provide the namespace, prefix, and tag name used for the root Element in the document instance.
doctype contains the optional TDOMDocumentType instance (or DTD) for the new document. When doctype is assigned, its OwnerDocument property is set to the new document instance created in the method.
CreateDocument raises EDOMError exceptions for the following:

dl.dd: Raised if QualifiedName contains an illegal character for an XML Name token.
Raised if QualifiedName is malformed, has a prefix and the namespaceURI is missing, or when the prefix that is "xml" does not match the value in stduri_xml.
Raised if doctype has already been used with a different document or was created from a different implementation.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocument.Result
element.short: XML document created in the method.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocument.NamespaceURI
element.short: NameSpace URI for the root element in the XML document.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocument.QualifiedName
element.short: QualifiedName for the root element in the XML document.

element.name: TDOMImplementation.CreateDocument.doctype
element.short: Document type appended to the XML document when assigned.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment
element.short: Implements the DocumentFragment interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMDocumentFragment is a TDOMNode_WithChildren descendant that implements the DocumentFragment interface from the DOM Level 2 specification. TDOMDocumentFragment is a "lightweight" or "minimal" Document object. It is often used as a temporary work area before applying changes to a TDOMDocument instance. Its content does not have to represent a well-formed XML document, but does require its child nodes to be well-formed XML parsed entities.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

descr.p: Returns DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE in TDOMDocumentFragment.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

descr.p: Returns a String with the value '#document-fragment' in TDOMDocumentFragment.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.CloneNode
element.short: Creates a copy of the document fragment with optional recursion into child nodes.

descr.p: CloneNode is a method used to create a document fragment with the content specified in ACloneOwner, the OwnerDocument for the clone. CloneNode implements the method defined for the Node interface in the DOM Level 2 specification.

CloneNode creates a new TDOMNode instance that is a duplicate of the document fragment node by calling the CreateDocumentFragment method in ACloneOwner. This causes ACloneOwner to be assigned as the OwnerDocument for the new node. The new node does not have a ParentNode.

The deep argument indicates if the child nodes in ACloneOwner are also duplicated in the method. When deep is True, the CloneChildren method is called to duplicate the child nodes (recursively). Cloning a DOM Element node using deep recursion also copies its attribute names and values. Set deep to False to limit the copy to the immediate node and its Attributes.
The return value contains a TDOMNode instance with the duplicated content for the node in ACloneOwner.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.CloneNode.Result
element.short: The new copy of the document fragment.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.CloneNode.deep
element.short: Indicates if child nodes are included in the cloned document fragment.

element.name: TDOMDocumentFragment.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: Document used as the owner of the cloned document fragment.

element.name: TNamespaces
element.short: Type used for namespaces in a DOM Document.

descr.p: TNamespaces is an array of DOMString type used to represent namespace values in a DOM Document. TNamespaces is the type used to implement the internal Namespaces member in TDOMDocument.

element.name: TDOMDocument
element.short: Implements the DOM Document interface.

descr.p: TDOMDocument is a TDOMNode_WithChildren descendant that implements the DOM Document interface from the DOM specification. TDOMDocument is the container that represents the content for the entire HTML or XML document. It acts as the root of the DOM tree.

TDOMDocument provides factory methods needed to create elements, attributes, text nodes, comments, processing instructions, etc. These items cannot exist without an owner document. It also provides methods used to import nodes created in another document or document fragment.
TDOMDocument provides support for XML Namespaces introduced in DOM Level 2. The following namespace prefixes and URIs are always assigned in TDOMDocument:
TDOMDocument includes the DocumentURI property introduced in DOM Level 3.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetDocumentElement
element.short: Gets the value for the DocumentElement property.

descr.p: The return value is the first child node in the document which is a DOM Element node (NodeType is ELEMENT_NODE). Starts at FirstChild and continues to NextSibling until a match is found. The node is cast to the TDOMElement type used for the property value.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetDocumentElement.Result
element.short: Value for the DocumentElement property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetDocType
element.short: Gets the value for the DocType property.

descr.p: The return value is the first child node in the document which has DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE in its NodeType property. Starts at FirstChild and continues to NextSibling until a match is found. The node is cast to the TDOMDocumentType type used for the property value.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetDocType.Result
element.short: Value for the DocType property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

descr.p: GetNodeType is an overridden method in TDOMDocument used to get the value for the NodeType property. It ensures that the property value is DOCUMENT_NODE for the TDOMDocument instance.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

descr.p: GetNodeName is an overridden method in TDOMDocument used to get the value for the NodeName property. It ensures that the property value is '#document' in the TDOMDocument instance.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetTextContent
element.short: Gets the value for the TextContent property.

descr.p: GetTextContent is an overridden method in TDOMDocument used to the value for the TextContent property. GetTextContent always returns an empty string ('') in TDOMDocument.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetTextContent.Result
element.short: Value for the TextContent property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetOwnerDocument
element.short: Gets the value for the OwnerDocument property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetOwnerDocument.Result
element.short: Value for the OwnerDocument property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.SetTextContent
element.short: Sets the value for the TextContent property.

descr.p: SetTextContent is ignored in TDOMDocument; the implementation is empty.

element.name: TDOMDocument.SetTextContent.value
element.short: New value for the TextContent property; ignored in TDOMDocument.

element.name: TDOMDocument.RemoveID
element.short: Removes a DOM element from the hash table used for IDs in the document.

descr.p: RemoveID is a method used to remove the DOM Element specified in Elem from the internal has table used for identifiers in the document. Calls the RemoveData method for the THashTable member in the class instance.
RemoveID is called when a TDOMElement instance is freed.

element.name: TDOMDocument.RemoveID.Elem
element.short: DOM Element to remove from the hash list for the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetChildNodeList
element.short: Gets a DOM Node List with the children for the specified DOM Node.

descr.p: GetChildNodeList is a TDOMNodeList function used to get a list with the child nodes in ANode.

If ANode is not a TDOMNode_WithChildren descendant, the return value is an empty TDOMNodeList instance with ANode as its parent. Otherwise, the value in the ChildNodes property in ANode is used as the return value.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetChildNodeList.Result
element.short: TDOMNodeList instance for the specified DOM node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetChildNodeList.aNode
element.short: DOM Node examined for child nodes in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementList
element.short: Gets a DOM Element List with elements found in the specified DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementList.Result
element.short: Element list generated in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementList.aNode
element.short: DOM Node examined in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementList.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for elements included in the list.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementList.aLocalName
element.short: LocalName for elements included in the list.

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementList.UseNS
element.short: Indicates if Namespaces are used when selecting elements in the list.

element.name: TDOMDocument.NodeListDestroyed
element.short: Signals that the specified list can be removed from the internal hash table.

descr.p: NodeListDestroyed is a method called when the TDOMNodeList instance in AList is freed.

Values in the Flags property are checked to determine whether the TDocument instance is being freed, or just the specified list. The RemoveData method in the internal THashTable member is called for the list in AList. No actions are performed in the method when the TDocument instance and its node lists are freed.

element.name: TDOMDocument.NodeListDestroyed.aList
element.short: Node list generating the notification.

element.name: TDOMDocument.Alloc
element.short: Ensures the DOM node class type is allocated using the Node pool for the document.

descr.p: Alloc is called when new DOM node specializations are created and added to the DOM node hierarchy. It is called from methods like:

dl.dd: CloneNode, SetAttributeNS
CloneNode
CloneNode

CreateElement, CreateElementBuf, CreateDocumentFragment, CreateTextNode, CreateTextNodeBuf, CreateComment, CreateCommentBuf, CreateAttribute, CreateAttributeBuf, CreateAttributeNS, CreateElementNS, CreateCDATASection
CreateProcessingInstruction, CreateEntityReference

element.name: TDOMDocument.Alloc.Result
element.short: DOM Node created using the class reference.

element.name: TDOMDocument.Alloc.AClass
element.short: DOM Node class to instantiate in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.IndexOfNS
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the specified namespace URI in the document namespaces.

element.name: TDOMDocument.IndexOfNS.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the Namespace URI, or -1 when not found.

element.name: TDOMDocument.IndexOfNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI to locate in the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.IndexOfNS.AddIfAbsent
element.short: Indicates if the Namespace URI is added if it does not already exist.

element.name: TDOMDocument.InsertBefore
element.short: Inserts a DOM Node prior to the reference DOM node.

descr.p: InsertBefore is an overridden method in TDOMDocument used to insert the DOM node specified in NewChild immediately before the node specified in RefChild.
InsertBefore checks the NodeType property in NewChild to ensure that the operation is valid for the node type. An EDOMHierarchyRequest exception is raised for either of the following conditions:

ul.li: NewChild is a DOM Element node and the DocumentElement has already been assigned.
NewChild is a DOM DocumentType node and the DocType property has already been assigned.

descr.p: InsertBefore calls the inherited method using NewChild and RefChild as arguments.

element.name: TDOMDocument.InsertBefore.Result
element.short: DOM Node inserted in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.InsertBefore.NewChild
element.short: New DOM Node to include in the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.InsertBefore.RefChild
element.short: Reference DOM Node that determines the location for the new DOM node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.ReplaceChild
element.short: Replaces a child node with another DOM node.

descr.p: ReplaceChild is an overridden TDOMNode function used to replace the DOM node in OldChild with the DOM node in NewChild.

ReplaceChild ensures that the DocumentElement can be replaced with the specified element node or DTD node in NewChild. When NewNode is not an element or DTD node, the inherited ReplaceChild method is called.
The return value is the TDOMNode instance in OldChild after it has been detached from the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.ReplaceChild.Result
element.short: TDOMNode instance detached from the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.ReplaceChild.NewChild
element.short: New DOM node to include in the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.ReplaceChild.OldChild
element.short: DOM Node replaced with the new DOM node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.DocType
element.short: Document Type declaration used in the document.

descr.p: DocType is a read-only TDOMDocumentType property that represents the Document Type declaration found in the child nodes for the document. DocType examines the top-level child nodes to find the first node with the value DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE in its NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.Impl
element.short: Provides access to the DOM Implementation for the document.

descr.p: Impl is a read-only TDOMImplementation property that provides access to the DOM Implementation for the document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.DocumentElement
element.short: Gets the root element for the document.

descr.p: DocumentElement is a read-only TDOMElement property that represents the root element for the document. DocumentElement is derived using the top-level child nodes found in the document. The return value contains the first DOM Node located that contains the value ELEMENT_NODE in its NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElement
element.short: Creates an element in the document with the specified tag name.

descr.p: CreateElement is a TDOMElement function used to create a new DOM Element with the tag name specified in tagName.

CreateElement calls Alloc to create the DOM Element in the internal node pool for the document. The value in tagName is checked for a QualifiedName matching a Namespace registered in the document, and added to the Namespace index if it does not already exist. CreateElement calls the AttachDefaultAttrs method in TDOMElement to add default attribute values required for the DOM Element.

errors.p: Raises an EDOMError exception with the exception code INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR if tagName does not contain a valid XML name.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElement.Result
element.short: DOM Element created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElement.tagName
element.short: Tag name used in the new DOM Element.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElementBuf
element.short: Creates an element in the document with the specified tag name.

descr.p: CreateElementBuf is a TDOMElement function used to create a new DOM Element with the tag name specified in the Buf argument. Buf is a DOMPChar type that contains a pointer the character data for the tagName.

CreateElementBuf calls Alloc to create the DOM Element in the internal node pool for the document. The value in Buf is checked for a qualified name matching a Namespace registered in the document, and added to the Namespace index if it does not already exist.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElementBuf.Result
element.short: DOM Element created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElementBuf.Buf
element.short: Pointer to character data used as the tag name for the Element.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateElementBuf.Length
element.short: Length of the values in Buf.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateDocumentFragment
element.short: Creates a new DOM Document Fragment.

descr.p: CreateDocumentFragment is a TDOMDocumentFragment function used to create an empty DOM Document Fragment. CreateDocumentFragment calls the Alloc method to enable memory management for the TDOMDocumentFragment class instance.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateDocumentFragment.Result
element.short: DOM Document Fragment created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNode
element.short: Creates a new DOM Text node with the specified value.

descr.p: CreateTextNode is a TDOMText function used to create a DOM Text node with the specified value. Data contains the value assigned to the NodeValue property in the TDOMText class instance. CreateTextNode calls the Alloc method to enable memory management for the new TDOMText class instance.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNode.Result
element.short: DOM Text node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNode.data
element.short: Value assigned to the new DOM Text node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNodeBuf
element.short: Creates a new DOM Text node with the specified value.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNodeBuf.Result
element.short: DOM Text node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNodeBuf.Buf
element.short: Pointer to the character data assigned to the new DOM Text node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNodeBuf.Length
element.short: Length of the buffer.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateTextNodeBuf.IgnWS
element.short: Indicates if whitespace in the buffer is ignored.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateCommentBuf.Length

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateCDATASection.data

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction.target

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction.data

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttribute
element.short: Creates a new DOM Attribute with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttribute.Result
element.short: DOM Attribute node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttribute.name
element.short: Name assigned to the DOM Attribute node.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttributeBuf
element.short: Creates a new DOM Attribute with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttributeBuf.Result
element.short: DOM Attribute node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttributeBuf.Buf

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttributeBuf.Length

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateAttributeDef.Result

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateEntityReference
element.short: Creates a new DOM Entity Reference for the specified name.

descr.remark: CreateEntityReference always raises an EDOMNotSupported exception. DOM Entity References are not supported in this DOM Implementation. Entity References in an existing document should have been converted to DOM Entities when the document was de-serialized.

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateEntityReference.Result

element.name: TDOMDocument.CreateEntityReference.name

element.name: TDOMDocument.GetElementsByTagName.tagname

element.name: TDOMDocument.ImportNode.ImportedNode

element.name: TDOMDocument.ImportNode.Deep

element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TDOMDocument.Destroy

element.name: TDOMDocument.AddID
element.short: Adds an ID Attribute value to a hash list used in the Document.

element.name: TDOMDocument.AddID.Result
element.short: True if the ID value was added, False if it already exists.

element.name: TDOMDocument.AddID.Attr
element.short: DOM Attribute node with the ID value to add to the hash list.

element.name: TDOMDocument.Names
element.short: Hash table representing qualified names used in the document.

descr.p: Names is a read-only THashTable property used to store QualifiedName values used in the DOM Document. Names is updated when DOM Elements or Attributes with Namespace URIs and qualified names are created in the document. It is also updated (re-hashed) when the Prefix property in the DOM Element or Attribute is changed.

element.name: TXMLDocument
element.short: Implements an XML Document.

descr.p: TXMLDocument is a TDOMDocument descendant that implements an XML Document. TXMLDocument provides extensions to the DOM Document interface needed when working with an XML Document. This includes the XMLVersion property as well as the Encoding, StylesheetType, and StylesheetHRef members. Overridden methods are also provided to handle creation of CDATA sections and Processing Instructions using valid XML names for the XMLVersion used in the document.

element.name: TXMLDocument.SetXMLVersion
element.short: Sets the value for the XMLVersion property.

element.name: TXMLDocument.SetXMLVersion.aValue
element.short: New value for the XMLVersion property.

element.name: TXMLDocument.Encoding
element.short: Encoding used for the XML Document.

descr.p: This member is an extension to the DOM interface.

element.name: TXMLDocument.StylesheetType
element.short: Type of Stylesheet represented by the StylesheetHRef property.

descr.p: This member is an extension to the DOM interface.

element.name: TXMLDocument.StylesheetHRef
element.short: URL for the Stylesheet to use for the Document.

descr.p: This member is an extension to the DOM interface.

element.name: TXMLDocument.XMLVersion
element.short: XML Version number supported in the document.

element.name: TNamespaceInfo
element.short: Represents Namespace Information used in DOM Node specializations.

descr.p: TNamespaceInfo is a packed record type used to represent Namespace Information used in DOM Node specializations. Members in the record are used to record the Index Position, PrefixLength, and a hash value for a Qualified Name assigned to namespaced DOM Elements and Attributes. TNamespaceInfo is the type used for the NSI property in TDOMNode_NS.

Please note that the NSIndex and PrefixLength members are declared as Word values. This limits the number of namespaces per document and the prefix length to 65535 (each). It is believed that higher values are only found in deliberately malformed documents.

element.name: TNamespaceInfo.NSIndex
element.short: Index position for the Namespace.

element.name: TNamespaceInfo.PrefixLen
element.short: Length of the Namespace Prefix.

element.name: TNamespaceInfo.QName
element.short: Qualified Name for the Namespace.

element.name: TAttrDataType
element.short: Enumeration with values for attribute types used in DOM Nodes.

descr.remark: This will eventually be altered or replaced when DOM Level 3 TypeInfo Interface support is introduced.

element.name: TAttrDataType.dtCdata
element.short: Attribute contains a CDATA value.

element.name: TAttrDataType.dtId

element.name: TAttrDataType.dtNotation

element.name: TDOMNode_NS
element.short: Implements a DOM Node with Namespace support.

descr.p: TDOMNode_NS is a TDOMNode_WithChildren descendant which provides support for Namespaces in DOM Nodes.

TDOMNode_NS extends the ancestor class to implement the use of XML Namespace as required in DOM Level 2. Overridden methods are provided for read and write accessors in the class which access the NodeName, LocalName, NamespaceURI and Prefix properties. It also implements the NSI property which is used to provide information about the Namespaces used in DOM Node specializations.
TDOMNode_NS is the ancestor class for the TDOMAttr and TDOMElement node types.

element.name: TDOMElement
element.short: Implements the DOM Element interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMElement is a TDOMNode_NS descendant that implements the DOM Element interface from the DOM specification. TDOMElement represents an element in an HTML or XML document. It inherits the capabilities defined in ancestor classes, and provides additional methods and properties need for the DOM Element interface.

Methods are provided to access Attributes using the Node interface defined in TDOMNode, or as a simple string value. Namespaces are supported for both the element and its attributes. The Normalize method is overridden to include normalization for values in the Attributes property.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

descr.p: GetNodeType is an overridden Integer function in TDOMElement used to get the value for the NodeType property. It returns the value from the ELEMENT_NODE constant as the property value.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributes
element.short: Gets the value for the Attributes property.

descr.p: GetAttributes is an overridden TDOMNamedNodeMap function in TDOMElement used to get the value for the Attributes property. It ensures that a TAttributeMap instance has been allocated for the Attributes member. TAttributeMap is an implementation class which provides namespace support in the TDOMNamedNodeMap descendant.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributes.Result
element.short: Value for the Attributes property.

element.name: TDOMElement.AttachDefaultAttrs
element.short: Creates attribute nodes with the default attribute values in a namespaced DOM Element.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method if namespace information with the qualified name and default attribute values for the Element has not been provided in the NSI property.
AttachDefaultAttrs calls RestoreDefaultAttr to creates and store a TDOMAttr instance in Attributes for each of the default attribute names and values found in the namespace information.
AttachDefaultAttrs is called from the CreateElement and CreateElementNS methods in TDOMDocument.

element.name: TDOMElement.InternalLookupPrefix
element.short: Gets the Namespace Prefix used for the specified Namespace URI.

element.name: TDOMElement.InternalLookupPrefix.Result
element.short: Prefix used for the Namespace in the current or ancestor DOM Element.

element.name: TDOMElement.InternalLookupPrefix.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI to locate in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.InternalLookupPrefix.Original
element.short: Original DOM Element to use for the Lookup.

element.name: TDOMElement.RestoreDefaultAttr
element.short: Restores the specified default attribute name and value in the DOM Element.

descr.p: RestoreDefaultAttr is a method used to restore the default attribute name and value specified in AttrDef to the Attributes for the DOM Element.

RestoreDefaultAttr checks for a namespace prefix in the name for the attribute, and applies the default namespace information for names starting with 'xmlns' or 'xml'. It calls LookupNamespaceURI to get and set the namespace URI for a name which starts with another prefix. It calls SetAttributeNode to add or update the node in the Attributes property.
RestoreDefaultAttr is called from the AttachDefaultAttrs method in TDOMElement. It is also called from the RestoreDefault method in TDOMNamedNodeMap.

element.name: TDOMElement.RestoreDefaultAttr.AttrDef
element.short: DOM Attribute used as the baseline.

element.name: TDOMElement.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It ensures that the Flags for the node are updated to include the value nfDestroying. If the OwnerDocument for the node has a hash table for node IDs, its RemoveID method is called to remove the current class instance. Destroy frees resources allocated for the Attributes property, and calls the inherited destructor prior to exit.

element.name: TDOMElement.CloneNode
element.short: Creates a DOM node that is a copy of the DOM Element.

descr.p: CloneNode is an overridden TDOMNode function in TDOMElement. It re-implements the method from the ancestor class to create a cloned copy of the DOM Element and its Attributes in the DOM Document specified in the ACloneOwner argument.

The cloning mechanism differs depending on whether ACloneOwner and OwnerDocument are the same TDOMDocument instance. Essentially, namespace information in the NSI property is reused when the document instances are the same, and only default attributes are cloned when the documents differ.
When deep is set to True, the CloneChildren method is called to recursively copy the ChildNodes for the Element.

element.name: TDOMElement.CloneNode.Result
element.short: DOM Node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.CloneNode.deep
element.short: Indicates if the entire DOM sub-tree is copied for the DOM Element.

element.name: TDOMElement.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: DOM Document that owns the new Node(s) created in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.IsEmpty
element.short: Indicates if the DOM Element does not have any content.

descr.p: IsEmpty is a Boolean function used to determine if the DOM element does not have any content. The return value is True when Attributes has not been assigned (contains Nil) or has a Length / Count of 0.
descr.remark: Technically, this implementation is incorrect. An empty element is one which has no child Text or Element nodes. And, an empty element can have attributes values (default or specified). Use HasChildNodes instead.

element.name: TDOMElement.IsEmpty.Result
element.short: True when the DOM Element is empty.

element.name: TDOMElement.Normalize
element.short: Performs normalization for Text nodes and Attributes in the DOM Element.

descr.p: Normalize is an overridden method in TDOMElement used to perform normalization for Text and Attribute nodes in the DOM element.

Normalize convert child text nodes in the sub-tree to their normal form where only structure nodes separate the text nodes. Adjacent text nodes are combined into a single text node. Adjacent text nodes which contain only ignorable whitespace are consolidated into a single whitespace value. The same actions are performed for nodes in the Attributes property.
Normalize implements the method defined for the DOM Node interface in the DOM Level 2 Specification.

element.name: TDOMElement.TagName
element.short: The qualified name used as the Tag name for the DOM Element.

descr.p: TagName is a read-only DOMString property which contains the tag name for the DOM Element. TagName can contain a qualified name which includes a Prefix for a Namespace used in the Element or its owner Document.
The property value is set when the Element is created using the argument passed to the CreateElement method in TDOMDocument. The value for the property is read from NodeName.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttribute
element.short: Gets the value for the AttribStrings property.

descr.p: GetAttribute is a DOMString function used to the value for the indexed AttribStrings property. The name argument contains the name for the attribute node to locate in the Attributes property.
No actions are performed in the method if the Attributes property has not been assigned in the class instance.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttribute.Result
element.short: Value for the AttribStrings property.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttribute.name
element.short: Name for the DOM Attribute requested in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttribute
element.short: Sets the value in the AttribStrings property.

descr.p: SetAttribute is a method used to set the value for an attribute in the indexed AttribStrings property. It calls Changing to ensure that the DOM Element is not marked as read-only. An EDOMError exception is raised if the element cannot be modified.

SetAttribute locates the TDOMAttr in the Attributes property with the name specified in the name argument. If it is not found, a new TDomAttr instance is created with the required name and added to Attributes. SetAttribute stores the value argument as the NodeValue for the attribute instance.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttribute.name
element.short: Name of the DOM Attribute updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttribute.value
element.short: New value for the attribute in the AttribStrings property.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttribute
element.short: Removes the DOM Attribute with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttribute.name
element.short: Name of the DOM Attribute removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNode
element.short: Gets the DOM Attribute node with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNode.Result
element.short: DOM Attribute node with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNode.name
element.short: Name for the DOM Attribute in the return value.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNode
element.short: Stores the new DOM Attribute node to an existing Attribute with the same name.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNode.Result
element.short: DOM Attribute node updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNode.NewAttr
element.short: DOM Attribute node with the new value stored in Attributes.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttributeNode
element.short: Removes the specified DOM Attribute node from the Attributes for the Element.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttributeNode.Result
element.short: DOM Attribute node removed in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttributeNode.OldAttr
element.short: DOM Attribute node to remove from the Attributes for the Element.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagName
element.short: Gets a list of DOM nodes with the specified name in the sub-tree for the Element.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagName.Result
element.short: DOM Node list with the specified tag name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagName.name
element.short: Tag name to locate in the DOM sub-tree.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNS
element.short: Gets the value for an Attribute with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNS.Result
element.short: Value for the DOM Attribute requested in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the Attribute requested in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNS.aLocalName
element.short: Local name for the Attribute requested in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNS
element.short: Sets the value for the DOM Attribute with the specified Namespace URI and qualified name.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the DOM Attribute updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNS.qualifiedName
element.short: QualifiedName for the DOM Attribute updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNS.value
element.short: New value for the DOM Attribute with the specified Namespace URI and Qualified Name.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttributeNS
element.short: Removes the DOM Attribute with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttributeNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the DOM Attribute.

element.name: TDOMElement.RemoveAttributeNS.aLocalName
element.short: Local name for the DOM Attribute.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNodeNS
element.short: Gets the DOM Attribute node with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNodeNS.Result
element.short: DOM Attribute node with the requested Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNodeNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the DOM Attribute.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetAttributeNodeNS.aLocalName
element.short: Local name for the DOM Attribute.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNodeNS
element.short: Stores the new DOM Attribute node in an existing Namespaced Attribute node.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNodeNS.Result
element.short: Existing DOM Attribute node updated in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.SetAttributeNodeNS.newAttr
element.short: DOM Attribute node with the Namespace URI, Local name, and value stored in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagNameNS
element.short: Gets a Node list with Elements having the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagNameNS.Result
element.short: DOM Node list created in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagNameNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the requested nodes.

element.name: TDOMElement.GetElementsByTagNameNS.aLocalName
element.short: Local name for the requested nodes.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttribute
element.short: Indicates if the Attributes property contains an item with the specified name.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttribute.Result
element.short: True when an Attribute with the specified name exists in the Attributes property.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttribute.name
element.short: Name of the Attribute to locate in the method.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttributeNS
element.short: Indicates if Attributes contains an attribute with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttributeNS.Result
element.short: True Attributes contains an entry with the specified Namespace URI and local name.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttributeNS.nsURI
element.short: Namespace URI for the DOM Attribute.

element.name: TDOMElement.hasAttributeNS.aLocalName
element.short: Local name for the DOM Attribute.

element.name: TDOMElement.HasAttributes
element.short: Indicates if the Attributes property contains DOM Attribute nodes.

descr.p: The return value is True when Attributes has been assigned and its Length is not 0.

element.name: TDOMElement.HasAttributes.Result
element.short: False when Attributes has not been assigned, or has a Length of 0 (zero).

element.name: TDOMElement.AttribStrings
element.short: Provides indexed access to Attributes and their value as a String.

descr.p: AttribStrings is an indexed DOMString property that provides access to the value for a DOM Attribute by its Name. AttribStrings is an extension to the DOM specification. It provides a simpler mechanism for reading and writing Attribute values than the methods provided in the DOM Node interface. It is especially useful for DOM documents where Attributes are known to contain simple DOMString data types (like HTML).

Read and write access to AttribStrings is redirected to the Attributes property. When reading a DOM Attribute, the value is an empty string ('') if the Attributes property does not contain an Attribute node with the requested Name. When writing a DOM Attribute, the Attribute node is created if it does not exist already.

AttribStrings does not take Qualified names or Namespaces into consideration when accessing values in the Attributes property. Use the GetAttributeNS, SetAttributeNS, or RemoveAttributeNS methods when Namespace support is required for DOM Attributes.

element.name: TDOMElement.AttribStrings.Name
element.short: Name of the DOM Attribute accessed in the indexed property.

element.name: TDOMText
element.short: Implements the DOM Text interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMText is a TDOMCharacterData descendant that implements the DOM Text interface from the DOM specification. TDOMText represents the textual content (called character data in XML) for a DOM Element or Attribute. It provides overridden methods which implement the NodeName and NodeValue properties as required for the DOM Node specialization.

Adjacent TDOMText nodes may be combined when the Normalize method is called for the ParentNode, and Text nodes with only whitespace in their content may be removed. This is the case when the DOM node has the value nfIgnorableWS in its Flags property.

element.name: TDOMText.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMText.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMText.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMText.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMText.SetNodeValue
element.short: Sets the value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMText.SetNodeValue.aValue
element.short: New value for the NodeValue property.

element.name: TDOMText.CloneNode
element.short: Makes a copy of the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMText.CloneNode.Result
element.short: New DOM Node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMText.CloneNode.deep
element.short: Indicates if child nodes in the sub-tree are included in the cloned DOM node.

element.name: TDOMText.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: DOM Document used to create the cloned DOM node.

element.name: TDOMText.SplitText
element.short: Splits the textual content at the specified offset into a new DOM Text node.

element.name: TDOMText.SplitText.Result
element.short: New DOM node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMText.SplitText.offset
element.short: Offset in the textual content where the Text node is split.

element.name: TDOMText.IsElementContentWhitespace
element.short: Indicates if the textual content for the node is whitespace characters.

element.name: TDOMText.IsElementContentWhitespace.Result
element.short: True when nfIgnorableWS is included in the Flags for the DOM node.

element.name: TDOMComment
element.short: Implements the DOM Comment interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMComment is a TDOMCharacterData descendant that implements the DOM Comment interface from the DOM specification. TDOMComment provides overridden methods needed to implement the NodeType and NodeName properties as required for the DOM Node specialization.

TDOMComment represents the textual content for a comment that appears between the '<!--' and '-->' delimiters. This is the definition for a comment as defined in the XML 1.0 specification and in HTML. The NodeValue can contain any values except the start and end delimiters for a comment.

element.name: TDOMComment.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMComment.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMComment.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMComment.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMComment.CloneNode
element.short: Makes copy of the DOM Comment node.

descr.p: CloneNode is a TDOMNode function used to create a copy or clone of the current DOM Comment node using the specified DOM Document as the owner of the new node. CloneNode calls the CreateComment method in the ACloneOwner argument to allocate and create the new TDOMComment instance, and store the character data in its Data property.
The value for the deep argument is not significant in the method; it is not used to clone a comment node.

element.name: TDOMComment.CloneNode.Result
element.short: DOM node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMComment.CloneNode.deep
element.short: True if child nodes are recursively copied in the method.

element.name: TDOMComment.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: DOM Document used to created the new DOM Comment node.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection
element.short: Implements the DOM CDataSection interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMCDATASection is a TDOMText descendant that implements the DOM CDATASection interface from the DOM specification. TDOMCDATASection provides overridden methods needed to implement the NodeType and NodeName properties as required for the DOM Node specialization.

TDOMCDATASection is used to escape text that contains characters that would otherwise be regarded as markup in a DOM document. TDOMCDATASection contains the textual content as it appears between the '<![CDATA[' and ']]>' delimiters. Its primary purpose is to include material such as XML fragments, without needing to escape all of the markup.

Please note that Markup (other than the ending delimiter) is ignored in a CDATA section. This means that the ending delimiter cannot be included in a CDATA section. Character numeric entity references cannot be used to escape content in a CDATA section.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

descr.p: GetNodeType is an overridden Integer function in TDOMCDATASection. It returns the value from the CDATA_SECTION_NODE constant as the property value.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

descr.p: GetNodeName is an overridden DOMString function in TDOMCDATASection. It returns '#cdata-section' as the property value.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.CloneNode
element.short: Makes a copy of the DOM CDATA Section.

descr.p: CloneNode is a TDOMNode function used to create a copy or clone of the current DOM CDATA section using the specified DOM Document as the owner of the new node. CloneNode calls the CreateCDATASection method in the ACloneOwner argument to allocate and create the new TDOMCDATASection instance with NodeValue from the current class instance.
The value for the deep argument is not significant in the method; it is not used to clone a CDATA node.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.CloneNode.Result
element.short: DOM Node created with the value for the CDATA Section.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.CloneNode.deep
element.short: Not used in the method.

element.name: TDOMCDATASection.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: DOM Document used to created the new DOM CDATA section node.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType
element.short: Implements the DOM DocumentType interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMDocumentType is a TDOMNode descendant that implements the DOM DocumentType Interface from the DOM specification.

Each DOM Document has a DocType property whose value is either Nil or a TDOMDocumentType instance. It provides an interface to the list of entities and notations that are defined for the document, as well as the PublicID and SystemID for the external subset.
It is often referred to as a DTD (Document Type Definition).

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetEntities
element.short: Gets the value for the Entities property.

descr.p: Ensures that a TDOMNamedNodeMap instance using the ENTITY_NODE node type has been allocated for the Entities property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetEntities.Result
element.short: Value for the Entities property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetNotations
element.short: Gets the value for the Notations property.

descr.p: Ensures that a TDOMNamedNodeMap instance using the NOTATION_NODE node type has been allocated for the Notations property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetNotations.Result
element.short: Value for the Notations property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

descr.p: GetNodeType is an overridden Integer function in TDOMDocumentType used to get the value for the NodeType property. It returns the value in the DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE constant as the property value.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

descr.p: GetNodeName is an overridden DOMString function in TDOMDocumentType used to get the value for the NodeName property. It returns the value in Name as the property value.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It ensures that resources allocated for the Entities and Notations properties are freed. It calls the inherited destructor prior to exit.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.Name
element.short: Name for the Document Type declaration (used as the root element).

descr.p: Name is a read-only DOMString property which contains the name for the document type declaration. This is the value used as the root element in a document instance created using the DTD. Name is set to the qualified name provided when the class instance is created using the CreateDocumentType method in TDOMImplementation.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.Entities
element.short: Entities declared in the Document Type declaration.

descr.p: Entities is a read-only TDOMNamedNodeMap property which contains the internal and external general entities declared in the DTD. It does not contain parameter entities.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.Notations
element.short: Notations declared in the Document Type declaration.

descr.p: Notations is a read-only TDOMNamedNodeMap property which contains the Notation declarations for the DTD. From the XML 1.0 Specification:

p.i: "Notations identify by name the format of unparsed entities, the format of elements which bear a notation attribute, or the application to which a processing instruction is addressed."

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.PublicID
element.short: Public Identifier for the Document Type declaration.

descr.p: PublicID is a read-only DOMString property which contains the public identifier for the external subset in the document type declaration. It contains the value passed as an argument to the CreateDocumentType method in TDOMImplementation, and stored in the new class instance.

PublicID was introduced in the SGML specifications (the predecessor of XML), and had an elaborate Formal Public Identifier format. For DOM and XML, the content has generally been simplified to an organization identifier and URL where the DTD is located. For example:
descr.code:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
or
<!DOCTYPE article PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DocBook XML V5.0//EN" "http://www.oasis-open.org/docbook/xml/5.0/docbookx.dtd">
descr.p: Use SystemID for the location on the local file system where the DTD is stored.
descr.remark: PublicID and SystemID are not validated in the DOM implementation (unlike XML). Both (or neither) of the values can be specified. URLs or local file paths are not verified.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.SystemID
element.short: System Identifier for the Document Type declaration.

descr.p: SystemID is a read-only DOMString property which contains the path to the document type declaration on the local file system. Its value is assigned using the argument passed to the CreateDocumentType method in TDOMImplementation.
Use PublicID for the URL where the DTD is located.
descr.remark: PublicID and SystemID are not validated in the DOM implementation (unlike XML). Both (or neither) of the values can be specified. URLs or local file paths are not verified.

element.name: TDOMDocumentType.InternalSubset
element.short: The internal subset for the Document Type declaration.

descr.p: InternalSubset is a read-only DOMString property which contains the portion of the document type declaration declared inline instead of externally. For example:

This document type declaration declares the profession and person elements as an internal subset, but relies on the file name.dtd to contain the declaration of the name element. The part of the DTD between the '[' and ']' brackets is the internal subset.

element.name: TDOMNotation
element.short: Implements the DOM Notation interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMNotation is a TDOMNode descendant which implements the Notation interface from the DOM specification. It declares the name and format for an unparsed entity declared in a Document Type Declaration (DTD). It can also be used to set the target for a processing instruction that handles the notation. Notations are a vestige of the older SGML standard, and provided for migration purposes. They are seldom used (if at all) in modern XML processing implementations.

element.name: TDOMNotation.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMNotation.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMNotation.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMNotation.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMNotation.CloneNode
element.short: Makes a copy of the DOM Node.

element.name: TDOMNotation.CloneNode.Result
element.short: DOM Node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMNotation.CloneNode.deep
element.short: True if child nodes are recursively copied in the method.

element.name: TDOMNotation.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
element.short: Document which owns the cloned notation node.

element.name: TDOMNotation.PublicID
element.short: Public Identifier for the Document Type declaration.

element.name: TDOMNotation.SystemID
element.short: System Identifier for the Document Type declaration.

element.name: TDOMEntity
element.short: Implements the DOM Entity interface from the DOM specification.

descr.p: TDOMEntity is a TDOMNode_WithChildren descendant which implements the Entity interface from the DOM specifications. An Entity is declared as part of a Document Type Declaration (DTD), and can be either parsed or unparsed in the content model. The following is an example of internal and external Entity declarations:
descr.code: <!ENTITY copyrightholder "ACME Corporation"> <!ENTITY copyrightholder PUBLIC "https://www.w3c.org/entities.dtd"> <!ENTITY copyrightholder SYSTEM "/path/to/entities.dtd"> <!-- Usage: --> <COPYRIGHT> 1999-2021, ©rightholder;. All rights reserved. </COPYRIGHT>
descr.p: TDOMEntity provides the Name (NodeName), PublicID or SystemID, and NotationName (when used) properties used to represent the entity declaration.

element.name: TDOMEntity.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

descr.p: Returns ENTITY_NODE as the property value.

element.name: TDOMEntity.GetNodeType.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeType property.

element.name: TDOMEntity.GetNodeName
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMEntity.GetNodeName.Result
element.short: Value for the NodeName property.

element.name: TDOMEntity.CloneNode
element.short: Makes a copy of the DOM node with the specified owner document.

descr.p: CloneNode is an overridden TDOMNode function in TDOMEntity used to make a copy of the node with ACloneOwner as the owner document for the new node. It re-implements the method from the ancestor class.

CloneNode allocates a new TDOMEntity instance in the node pool for ACloneOwner, and creates the DOM Entity node in the return value. Values from the PublicID, SystemID, and NotationName properties are copied to the new node. The internal name for the Entity (set when the owner document was de-serialized) is also copied to the new node. When deep is True, the CloneChildren method is called to copy the ChildNodes (when assigned) to the new node.
CloneNode calls SetReadOnly to ensure that the new node cannot be modified. The cloned node does not have a parent node.

element.name: TDOMEntity.CloneNode.Result
element.short: DOM node created in the method.

element.name: TDOMEntity.CloneNode.deep
element.short: True if child nodes are recursively copied in the method.

element.name: TDOMEntity.CloneNode.aCloneOwner
element.short: Document which owns the clones Entity node.

element.name: TDOMEntity.PublicID
element.short: Public Identifier for the Entity.

descr.p: Can contain a URL where the DTD with the entity declaration is located on the internet. It can contain the Formal Public Identifier notation used in SGML/XML.

element.name: TDOMEntity.SystemID
element.short: System Identifier for the Entity.

descr.p: Can contain a path to the DTD with the entity declaration on the local file system.

element.name: TDOMEntity.NotationName
element.short: Notation name for the Entity.

descr.p: Can contain the DOM Notation name used for the Entity. This is seldom used in modern XML processors.

element.name: TDOMEntityReference
element.short: Implements the DOM EntityReference interface from the DOM specification.

element.name: TDOMEntityReference.GetNodeType
element.short: Gets the value for the NodeType property.

element.short: Makes a copy of the DOM Entity Reference node.

element.name: TDOMEntityReference.CloneNode.ACloneOwner
